analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aa bhi dharmma ka sho bh'a shya t'i k'a ta tv'artha n'a ma /
analyzed: aa bhi dharmma ka sho bh'a shya t'i k'a ta tv'artha n'a ma /
translated: Abhidharmako≈õabhƒÅ·π£ya·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ-tattvƒÅrthƒÅ-nƒÅma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi bshad pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi bshad pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the Abhidharmako≈õa, the extensive commentary called The Reality of the Meaning

original: don gyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: don gyi de kho na nyid ces bya ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: gang zhig kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhing //
translated: He who has utterly destroyed the darkness in all things,

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
translated: And has drawn forth the world from the mire of cyclic existence,

original: don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having paid homage to him, the teacher of reality,

original: chos mngon mdzod kyi bstan bcos rab bshad bya //üîΩbstan bcos mdzad par bzhed pas rang gi ston pa la bstod pa brtsams pa'i dgos pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos mngon mdzod kyi bstan bcos rab bshad bya // bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed pas rang gi ston pa la bstod pa brtsams pa'i dgos pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: I shall explain the treatise on the Abhidharmako≈õa.üîΩWith the intention of the purpose of composing the treatise, he begins by praising his own teacher, saying:

original: de yang bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus par bskyed pas rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bshad pas /
analyzed: de yang bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus par bskyed pas rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bshad pas /
translated: Moreover, by generating respect for the treatise and the teacher, the perfect benefit for oneself and others is explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i bdag nyid shes shing gus pa bskyed pa dang / ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ldan pas /üîΩde'i gsung mi bden pa'i gtan tshigs dang bral zhing don phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba'i sems can rnams drangs te 'bras bu mthar @2a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i bdag nyid shes shing gus pa bskyed pa dang / ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ldan pas / de'i gsung mi bden pa'i gtan tshigs dang bral zhing don phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyis 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba'i sems can rnams drangs te 'bras bu mthar @2a * //
translated: The greatness of the Bhagavat is known and respect is generated, and because he is endowed with the perfection of intuition and abandonment,

original: thug pa la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: his speech is free from the reason of untruth and because of the very non-erroneousness of its meaning, he draws out the sentient beings who are sunk in the mire of cyclic existence and joins them to the ultimate fruit.

original: bstan bcos la gus pa bskyed pa'i don ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos la gus pa bskyed pa'i don ni de bzhin te /
translated: The meaning of generating respect for the treatise is just that.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dgos pa'i snying po yang ngo //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dgos pa'i snying po yang ngo //
translated: The essence of the purpose is also that.

original: gus par gyur pas bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung so sor rang gis rig cing bstan bcos kyi bzhed pa de dang don mtshungs pa'i phyir dang dgos pa mtshungs pa'i phyir gus pa 'dir ma bshad kyang grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gus par gyur pas bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung so sor rang gis rig cing bstan bcos kyi bzhed pa de dang don mtshungs pa'i phyir dang dgos pa mtshungs pa'i phyir gus pa 'dir ma bshad kyang grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since one becomes respectful, one individually intuits the speech of the Sugata, and because the purport of the treatise is similar to that and because the purpose is similar, this respect is established even though it is not explained here.

original: mi bden pa'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro dang 'jigs pa dag yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro dang 'jigs pa dag yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The basis of the false reason should be understood as attachment, anger, and fear.

original: 'di rnams kyis ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the perfection of knowledge and abandonment.

original: gus pa bskyed pa rnams kyang klog pa dang kha ton dang nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la 'bad cing zhugs pas 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba de las rgol ba thob par byed do //
analyzed: gus pa bskyed pa rnams kyang klog pa dang kha ton dang nyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la 'bad cing zhugs pas 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba de las rgol ba thob par byed do //
translated: Those who generate respect will strive and engage in the activities of reading, recitation, listening, and contemplation, and thus attain liberation from the mire of cyclic existence.

original: 'o na bstan bcos la gus pa bskyed pa kho na 'di'i don ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na bstan bcos la gus pa bskyed pa kho na 'di'i don ma yin nam /
translated: But isn't the purpose of this text to generate respect for the treatise?

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is it that causes one to understand the greatness of the BhagavƒÅn here?

original: 'ga' zhig gang zag tshad mar byed pa yod pas de rnams gang zag nyid kyi sgo nas de'i tshig la gus par byed cing /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang zag tshad mar byed pa yod pas de rnams gang zag nyid kyi sgo nas de'i tshig la gus par byed cing /
translated: Some people take the person as an authority, so they respect his words through the person himself.

original: don la rtogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang bla na med pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa @2b thos nas de'i tshig gus pas nyan pa nas tshig dang rtags dang don la yongs su rtogs pa'i bar byed do //
analyzed: don la rtogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang bla na med pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa @2b thos nas de'i tshig gus pas nyan pa nas tshig dang rtags dang don la yongs su rtogs pa'i bar byed do //
translated: In fact, those who understand the meaning of the teaching, having heard the perfection of the wisdom and abandonment of the unsurpassed, respectfully listen to the words of the teaching, and then thoroughly investigate the words, signs, and meaning.

original: de nas ston pa'i tshig dang don dag ji ltar thos pa bzhin du ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par nges te /
analyzed: de nas ston pa'i tshig dang don dag ji ltar thos pa bzhin du ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par nges te /
translated: Then, they ascertain that the teacher possesses the perfection of wisdom and abandonment just as they heard the words and meaning of the teaching.

original: ston pa la gus pa skye'o //
analyzed: ston pa la gus pa skye'o //
translated: They give rise to respect for the teacher.

original: de la bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i don du bstod pa mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: de la bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i don du bstod pa mngon par brjod do //
translated: For that reason, one who wishes to compose a treatise, in order to generate respect for the treatise and the teacher, expresses praise.

original: 'o na che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa nyid 'dir dgos par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa nyid 'dir dgos par gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it stated here that the purpose is to make known the greatness of the teacher?

original: che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i don du yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de la phyag 'tshal ba rtsom mo zhes te ;
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i don du yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de la phyag 'tshal ba rtsom mo zhes te ;
translated: For the purpose of making known the greatness of the teacher, one begins to pay homage to him by first expressing his qualities.

original: de ni bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi phyir gsungs pa bden no //
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi phyir gsungs pa bden no //
translated: It is true that this is stated as the reason for generating respect for the treatise and the teacher.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na bstan bcos kyi thog mar che ba'i bdag nyid rab tu bstan pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na bstan bcos kyi thog mar che ba'i bdag nyid rab tu bstan pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Otherwise, what is the point of teaching the greatness of the treatise at the beginning?

original: che ba'i bdag nyid kyi yon tan brjod pa ni bstan bcos rtsom pa la bltos pa med par yang bstan nus pa'i phyir bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir bstod pa mngon par brjod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid kyi yon tan brjod pa ni bstan bcos rtsom pa la bltos pa med par yang bstan nus pa'i phyir bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir bstod pa mngon par brjod pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The qualities of greatness can be taught without depending on composing a treatise, so the one who wishes to compose a treatise should be seen as expressing praise in order to make the greatness known.

original: phan 'dogs pas na bstan bcos so //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pas na bstan bcos so //
translated: It is a treatise because it benefits.

original: de'i phyir ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid las bstan bcos la gus pa skye zhing bstan bcos kyi nus pa las ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid nges te gus pa skye'o zhes sngar bshad pa nyid legs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid las bstan bcos la gus pa skye zhing bstan bcos kyi nus pa las ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid nges te gus pa skye'o zhes sngar bshad pa nyid legs so //
translated: Therefore, respect for the treatise arises from the greatness of the teacher, and the greatness of the teacher is ascertained from the power of the treatise. It is better to generate respect as previously explained.

original: de ltar na bstod pa las bstan bcos kyi don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bstod pa las bstan bcos kyi don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the treatise is understood from the praise.

original: yang na gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa ni dngos kyi dgos pa zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: yang na gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa ni dngos kyi dgos pa zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Or else, the ultimate purpose is explained as that which causes the understanding of the greatness of the treatise, which is transmitted from one to another.

original: gus pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gus pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: But the transmission of respect from one to another is not the purpose.

original: gzhan du na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yang brjod byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yang brjod byar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the attainment of nirvana would be the subject matter.

original: yang na dgos pa ni bstan bcos rtsom pa'i gegs bsal ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar sog pa la 'dod de sems zhi ba dang bsod nams kyi las nye bar sog pa las gzhan pa'i dgos pa med do //
analyzed: yang na dgos pa ni bstan bcos rtsom pa'i gegs bsal ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar sog pa la 'dod de sems zhi ba dang bsod nams kyi las nye bar sog pa las gzhan pa'i dgos pa med do //
translated: Or else, the purpose is the removal of obstacles to the composition of the treatise and the accumulation of the roots of virtue, because there is no purpose other than the pacification of the mind and the accumulation of meritorious karma.

original: gegs dang bral bas rtsom pa'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhing mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa la sbyor ba ni lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gegs dang bral bas rtsom pa'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhing mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa la sbyor ba ni lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: And when one is free from obstacles, the activity of composition is completed, and one is connected with high status and certain goodness, what need is there to mention the other?

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan phul du byung ba thams cad mnga' zhing skyon dang bral ba mthar @3a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan phul du byung ba thams cad mnga' zhing skyon dang bral ba mthar @3a * //
translated: Therefore the master says that the Tathagata possesses all sublime qualities and is free of faults.üîΩ

original: phyin pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing dang lam de la phyag 'tshal ba rtsom par mdzad do //üîΩci ltar na ming gi yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba la sbyar bas phul du byung ba'i 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi dang bsod nams kyi phung po thob pa dang bgegs dang log par 'dren pa dang bral te bstan bcos yongs
analyzed: phyin pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing dang lam de la phyag 'tshal ba rtsom par mdzad do // ci ltar na ming gi yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag 'tshal ba la sbyar bas phul du byung ba'i 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi dang bsod nams kyi phung po thob pa dang bgegs dang log par 'dren pa dang bral te bstan bcos yongs
translated: Therefore, the Master composed this homage to the Tathagata, the supreme field of merit and path, because he is the master of all excellent qualities, free from all faults, and the ultimate state.

original: su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that by applying homage preceded by the expression of his name, he obtains the four excellent desired results, a heap of merit, is free from obstacles and hindrances, and the treatise is completed?

original: nyan pa po rnams che ba'i bdag nyid thos pa las rab tu dad pa mngon par 'phel te 'jug cing de'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsod nams kyi tshogs thob pa dang bgegs dang log 'dren rnams dang bral te 'bad pa med par klog pa dang kha don dang mnyan
analyzed: nyan pa po rnams che ba'i bdag nyid thos pa las rab tu dad pa mngon par 'phel te 'jug cing de'i rgyu mtshan gyis bsod nams kyi tshogs thob pa dang bgegs dang log 'dren rnams dang bral te 'bad pa med par klog pa dang kha don dang mnyan
translated: The listeners, having heard about the greatness of the teacher, will develop faith and engage in the study. As a result of this, they will acquire the accumulation of merit, be free from obstacles and misleading influences and will be able to read, recite and listen to the teachings without any difficulty.

original: pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par la mthar phyin par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par la mthar phyin par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When listeners hear of the greatness of the Buddha, their faith increases and they enter the teaching. For that reason, they obtain the collection of merit, are freed from obstructors and misleading influences and without effort they engage in the special activities of reading, reciting, listening and so on until they are perfected.

original: yang na bstan bcos byed pa phal cher rtsom pa la 'jug pa na 'dod pa'i lha la phyag byas nas 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: yang na bstan bcos byed pa phal cher rtsom pa la 'jug pa na 'dod pa'i lha la phyag byas nas 'jug par byed de /
translated: Or, when most authors of treatises begin their composition, they pay homage to the desire realm gods and then begin.

original: slob dpon 'dis kyang mchog tu legs pa'i lam de'i rjes su 'jug pas bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed de yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal ba brtsams so //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dis kyang mchog tu legs pa'i lam de'i rjes su 'jug pas bstan bcos mdzad par bzhed de yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal ba brtsams so //
translated: Since this master also wishes to compose a treatise that follows that excellent path, he pays homage with a statement of qualities at the beginning.

original: yang ci'i don du bstan bcos rtsom pa na 'dod pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i don du bstan bcos rtsom pa na 'dod pa'i lha la phyag 'tshal bar byed ce na /
translated: Why do authors pay homage to the desire realm gods when they begin to compose treatises?

original: bkra shis pa'i ched du dam pa rnams kyis bya ste /
analyzed: bkra shis pa'i ched du dam pa rnams kyis bya ste /
translated: The wise should compose them for the sake of auspiciousness.

original: bstan bcos la 'jug pa na kun tu nye bar phan pa ni bkra shis te tshe dang ldan zhing slob ma shes nyan can dang / skyes bu dpa' bo rnams su yang 'gyur ba'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos la 'jug pa na kun tu nye bar phan pa ni bkra shis te tshe dang ldan zhing slob ma shes nyan can dang / skyes bu dpa' bo rnams su yang 'gyur ba'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: The auspiciousness of the treatise is the complete benefit of the author, who becomes long-lived, has disciples who are wise and attentive, and is a hero.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa ni bdag nyid kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i rab tu dang ba bstan pa'i don dang gzhan dag la yang bskyed pa'i don te 'di yang bstan bcos la nye bar byed par bsams pa'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid shes par byed pa ni bdag nyid kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i rab tu dang ba bstan pa'i don dang gzhan dag la yang bskyed pa'i don te 'di yang bstan bcos la nye bar byed par bsams pa'o zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: The greatness of the treatise is the teaching of the author's own faith in the object and the generation of faith in others. This is also considered to be the benefit of the treatise.

original: bstan bcos kyi thog mar bstod pa mngon par brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis dam bcas pa nyid bstan bcos zhes dgos na /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi thog mar bstod pa mngon par brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis dam bcas pa nyid bstan bcos zhes dgos na /
translated: If the treatise is composed for the purpose of praising the treatise at the beginning, then the author's own statement would be the treatise.

original: de byed pa ni mun pa ma spang ba'i phyir bstan bcos lam  gus pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de byed pa ni mun pa ma spang ba'i phyir bstan bcos lam  gus pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is done, the treatise would not be respected because the darkness of ignorance is not dispelled.

original: bstod pa mngon par brjod pas ni gzhan dag gis bstan bcos so so rang gi yang dag pa nyid shes pas bstan bcos 'di la gus pa skyes par byed do //
analyzed: bstod pa mngon par brjod pas ni gzhan dag gis bstan bcos so so rang gi yang dag pa nyid shes pas bstan bcos 'di la gus pa skyes par byed do //
translated: The expression of praise causes others to respect this treatise, since they understand that it is correct in its own individual way.

original: de lta na yang bstod pa mngon par brjod pa don med pa min te /üîΩgzhan du bstan bcos nye bar gyur pa nyid rtogs /
analyzed: de lta na yang bstod pa mngon par brjod pa don med pa min te / gzhan du bstan bcos nye bar gyur pa nyid rtogs /
translated: Even so, the expression of praise is not meaningless,üîΩsince it causes one to understand that the treatise is at hand.

original: @3b de'i don nyid las 'di la yang dag par 'jug cing de'i rten yin pas chos mngon pa mdzod ces rab tu grags pa ston par byed pa rnams nyid la yang gus pa bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: @3b de'i don nyid las 'di la yang dag par 'jug cing de'i rten yin pas chos mngon pa mdzod ces rab tu grags pa ston par byed pa rnams nyid la yang gus pa bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Since the treatise is the basis for the meaning itself, it is well known as the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: ston par byed pa rab tu grags pa rnams la yang tshig tsam gyis sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ston par byed pa rab tu grags pa rnams la yang tshig tsam gyis sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the expression of praise is established merely by words.

original: slar yang bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of composing the treatise again?

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni dngos kyi dgos pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yang dgos pa yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni dngos kyi dgos pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yang dgos pa yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The realization of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena is the direct purpose, and the attainment of nirvana is the ultimate purpose.

original: gang gi phyir 'gro ba lnga po rnams su las dang nyon mongs pa gnyis rgyur gyur pa las yang srid 'phen pa'i dus dang 'phangs pa'i yang srid mngon par 'grub pa'i dus dag tu las dang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa rnams yang srid 'phen par byed cing
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba lnga po rnams su las dang nyon mongs pa gnyis rgyur gyur pa las yang srid 'phen pa'i dus dang 'phangs pa'i yang srid mngon par 'grub pa'i dus dag tu las dang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa rnams yang srid 'phen par byed cing
translated: Because in the five realms, those who have not abandoned karma and afflictions, in the phase of projecting a new existence due to the two being causes, and in the phase of actualizing the projected new existence, project a new existence

original: skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skyed par byed do //
translated: and give rise to it.

original: des sems can rnams ji srid nyon mongs par gyur pa de srid du 'khor ba las thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sems can rnams ji srid nyon mongs par gyur pa de srid du 'khor ba las thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, as long as sentient beings are afflicted, they will not be liberated from cyclic existence.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spongs pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ma gtogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams spongs pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Apart from the thorough differentiation of phenomena, there is no other means to abandon the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang mi shes pa la gnas pa'i phyir chos khong du chud pa'i shes pa dang snang ba dang mun pa bzhin du mtshan nyid 'gal bas lhan cig tu mi gnas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang mi shes pa la gnas pa'i phyir chos khong du chud pa'i shes pa dang snang ba dang mun pa bzhin du mtshan nyid 'gal bas lhan cig tu mi gnas so //
translated: Also, all afflictions are based on ignorance, so they do not coexist with the knowledge that comprehends phenomena, just as light and darkness have contradictory characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa las nyon mongs pa spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa las nyon mongs pa spong bar byed cing /

original: gtan zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i tshig yin gyi de dang tshig bsdu ba ni ma yin te mi zad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i tshig yin gyi de dang tshig bsdu ba ni ma yin te mi zad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúever‚Äù is a near synonym, not a compound word, because it is not inexhaustible.

original: 'o na mun pa bcom pa ni tshig phyi ma gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mun pa bcom pa nyid gtso bo ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mun pa bcom pa ni tshig phyi ma gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mun pa bcom pa nyid gtso bo ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the destruction of darkness primary because the latter term is primary?

original: gtso bo yang bya ba gzhan dang 'brel bar mthong ste /
analyzed: gtso bo yang bya ba gzhan dang 'brel bar mthong ste /
translated: The primary is also seen to be related to other actions.

original: pa khra mo khrid shog ces pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa khra mo khrid shog ces pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúBring the cow with the white tail.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang shes bya thams cad la mun pa bcom pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang shes bya thams cad la mun pa bcom pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, here, the destruction of the darkness of all objects of knowledge should be understood as the Blessed One.

original: yang na de'i mun pa bcom pa 'di lta bu'i 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na de'i mun pa bcom pa 'di lta bu'i 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, it is not the desire that his darkness is destroyed in this way.

original: 'o na ci'i 'dod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i 'dod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Then what is the desire?

original: shes bya thams cad la bcom ldan 'das mun pa bcom pa nyid na /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la bcom ldan 'das mun pa bcom pa nyid na /
translated: When the Blessed One destroys the darkness of all objects of knowledge,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bdun pa de'i skyes bur yang mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bdun pa de'i skyes bur yang mi sbyar ro //
translated: the Blessed One is not connected as a person with the seventh case.

original: 'di ni nges par gtso bo nyid dang 'brel ba ma yin pas yon tan du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nges par gtso bo nyid dang 'brel ba ma yin pas yon tan du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a quality because it is not definitely connected with the primary meaning,

original: don las 'brel ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don las 'brel ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the connection is taught from the meaning.

original: dper na / khyod gdong autpal sngon po'i 'dab 'dra'i mig / de yi ze 'bru dang mtshungs dri ldan 'di'i //
analyzed: dper na / khyod gdong autpal sngon po'i 'dab 'dra'i mig / de yi ze 'bru dang mtshungs dri ldan 'di'i //
translated: For example, Your eyes are like blue lotus petals, this one is like its stamen and has fragrance.

original: zhes so // kun la mun pa bcom pa mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // kun la mun pa bcom pa mi srid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is impossible to destroy the darkness of all,

original: mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: it is not impossible.

original: @7b srid pa las ni yon tan du gyur pa las mun pa bcom pa nyid kyis yul thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @7b srid pa las ni yon tan du gyur pa las mun pa bcom pa nyid kyis yul thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
translated: From existence, the one who has become virtuous, by destroying darkness, knows all objects.

original: chang gis ma myos pa bzhin no //üîΩdper na chang gi btung ba dang mig nyams pa mig nyams bzhin no //
analyzed: chang gis ma myos pa bzhin no // dper na chang gi btung ba dang mig nyams pa mig nyams bzhin no //
translated: Like one who is not intoxicated by alcohol.

original: myos pa'am mi gzhar bas btung ba'i gzhi dang mig gi gzhi shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myos pa'am mi gzhar bas btung ba'i gzhi dang mig gi gzhi shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, one who is intoxicated by alcohol or one whose eyes are impaired does not know the basis of alcohol or the basis of eyes.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gang zhig ma myos pa'am ma long ba des ni btung ba'i yul dang mig gi yul yang rnam par shes so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gang zhig ma myos pa'am ma long ba des ni btung ba'i yul dang mig gi yul yang rnam par shes so //
translated: But what is it? The one who is not intoxicated or not blind knows the object of alcohol or the object of the eyes.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mun pa bcom pa ni yul thams cad shes par 'gyur bas mchog tu mun pa bcom pa nyid de //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mun pa bcom pa ni yul thams cad shes par 'gyur bas mchog tu mun pa bcom pa nyid de //
translated: In the same way, here also, the Blessed One, by destroying darkness, knows all objects. Therefore, the one who has destroyed darkness is supreme.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni tshig gnyis pa'i 'bru mang po pa'i snying po can bdun pa'i skyes bu zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni tshig gnyis pa'i 'bru mang po pa'i snying po can bdun pa'i skyes bu zhes so //
translated: Therefore, this is the seventh person with the essence of the two-word compound.

original: de la 'bad pa ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de la 'bad pa ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
translated: Here, effort is in all aspects.

original: gtan zhes bya ba ni don nye bar ston pa lhur byed pa yin gyi tshig rnam par sbyar ba lhur byed pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gtan zhes bya ba ni don nye bar ston pa lhur byed pa yin gyi tshig rnam par sbyar ba lhur byed pa ni ma yin la /
translated: The term ‚Äúeternal‚Äù is used to indicate the teaching of the meaning, not the teaching of the verbal expression.

original: kun la mun bcom zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba lhur byed pa yin no //
analyzed: kun la mun bcom zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba lhur byed pa yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúdestroyer of the darkness of all‚Äù is used to indicate the teaching of the verbal expression.

original: de la mun pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dbye ba dang don gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mam /
analyzed: de la mun pa'i rnam pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dbye ba dang don gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mam /
translated: Darkness is of two kinds: that which is afflicted and that which is not afflicted. It is of three kinds when divided according to the realms of sense-desire and the formless realm, and according to the division of the object.

original: spong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Or it is of five kinds when divided according to the five types of abandonment.

original: shes bya thams cad ni skye mched bcu gnyis rnams te /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad ni skye mched bcu gnyis rnams te /
translated: All that is to be known is the twelve sense spheres.

original: mdo las bram ze thams cad ces bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis kyi bar rnams so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las bram ze thams cad ces bya ba ni skye mched bcu gnyis kyi bar rnams so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For a sutra declares, ‚ÄúBrahmin, all means all of the twelve sense spheres.‚Äù

original: rnam pa lnga ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: The five types are form, mind, the mental concomitants, the dissociated formative forces, and the unconditioned.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'am /
translated: The two types are contaminated and uncontaminated.üîΩ

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The two aspects are: contaminated and uncontaminated, or conditioned and unconditioned.

original: 'jig rten na phyi rol gyi mun pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs mthong ba la gegs su gyur pa'i phyir skye bo long ba bzhin du byed pas mun pa zhes grags kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na phyi rol gyi mun pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs mthong ba la gegs su gyur pa'i phyir skye bo long ba bzhin du byed pas mun pa zhes grags kyi /
translated: Darkness is well known in the world as the obscuration of the seeing of forms such as pots, etc., because it acts like blindness.

original: 'dir ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gegs su gyur pas 'dra ba'i phyir mi shes pa kho na mun pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi shes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la gegs su gyur pa'i phyir mun pa ste zhes gsungs so //üîΩyang dag pa'i don mthong ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgoms pas bsdus pa phyin ci ma log pa'i @8a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gegs su gyur pas 'dra ba'i phyir mi shes pa kho na mun pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi shes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la gegs su gyur pa'i phyir mun pa ste zhes gsungs so // yang dag pa'i don mthong ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgoms pas bsdus pa phyin ci ma log pa'i @8a * //
translated: But here, ignorance alone is darkness because it is similar to darkness in that it is the obscuration of the seeing of the correct meaning.

original: don mthong ba'o //
analyzed: don mthong ba'o //
translated: The seeing of the correct meaning is the seeing of the unmistaken meaning, which is included in hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: de la gegs su gyur pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba de la gegs skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la gegs su gyur pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba de la gegs skyed pa'o //
translated: The obscuration of that is the generation of an obscuration to the seeing of the correct meaning.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Seeing the meaning that is not real is the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: de la ni gegs su gyur pa ma yin te ma rig pas phan btags pa kho na las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni gegs su gyur pa ma yin te ma rig pas phan btags pa kho na las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not an obstruction to that, because it arises only through the benefit of ignorance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa'i don mthong ba smos pa ni khyad par yin no zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa'i don mthong ba smos pa ni khyad par yin no zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: The mention of seeing the real meaning is a distinction, because it is not an obstruction to that.

original: zag pa med pa mthong ba gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa mthong ba gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say: It is seeing the real meaning because it is the principal seeing of the uncontaminated.

original: 'dir don gzhan de nyid yang dag pa'i don du bzhed de /
analyzed: 'dir don gzhan de nyid yang dag pa'i don du bzhed de /
translated: Here, the meaning of that is asserted to be the real meaning.

original: de ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi chos yul dang dus shin tu bskal pa dang don rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi chos yul dang dus shin tu bskal pa dang don rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pa nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said: Even though the Buddha‚Äôs Dharma is extremely remote in terms of object and time, and its meaning is infinitely differentiated, there is indeed nonafflicted ignorance.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa ni ma rig pa'i zhes bzhed do ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa ni ma rig pa'i zhes bzhed do ;
translated: It is asserted that the opposite of the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata is ignorance.

original: / thos pa las byung ba la sogs pas mthong ba yang dag pa'i don mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: / thos pa las byung ba la sogs pas mthong ba yang dag pa'i don mthong ba yin te /
translated: The seeing that arises from hearing and so on is the seeing of the correct meaning.

original: 'di'i shes bya'i yul thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i shes bya'i yul thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do //
translated: The object of knowledge of all of these is inconceivable.

original: de dag lhag ma ma lus shing phyin ci ma log pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can du mkhyen pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong bar bzhed do zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag lhag ma ma lus shing phyin ci ma log pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can du mkhyen pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong bar bzhed do zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the knowledge of all of these without exception and without error in the aspects of their general and specific characteristics is accepted as the seeing of the correct meaning.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the aspects of others.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pa spong ba'i dbang du byas nas shes bya thams cad la zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pa spong ba'i dbang du byas nas shes bya thams cad la zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that all objects of knowledge are for the sake of abandoning afflicted and unafflicted delusion.

original: gnyen po brnyes pas zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar byed pa'i phyogs ni gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gnyen po brnyes pas zhes bya ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar byed pa'i phyogs ni gnyen po ste /
translated: Obtaining the antidote means that the antidote is the side that abandons the opposing side.

original: de yang gcig na rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: de yang gcig na rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: That is the vajra-like samadhi.

original: 'di ltar rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su bcom ldan 'das gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dang thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyi nus pa mnga' bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su bcom ldan 'das gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dang thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes kyi nus pa mnga' bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, immediately after the vajra like concentration, the Bhagavat becomes liberated from both parts, and he possesses the power of the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all objects.

original: de brnyes pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: de brnyes pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: He obtains this by the nature of manifestation.

original: de dang por thob pas so zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: de dang por thob pas so zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say that he obtains it for the first time.

original: 'di ni bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam par bya ste /
translated: This should be considered.

original: rdo rje lta bu nyid kyis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu nyid kyis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not abandon it through the vajra like concentration itself.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams las srid pa'i rtse mo pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chud du'i chung ngu las gzhan @8b bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad kyi gnyen po ma yin zhes gzhan dag sems te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams las srid pa'i rtse mo pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chud du'i chung ngu las gzhan @8b bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad kyi gnyen po ma yin zhes gzhan dag sems te /
translated: Others think that the vajra like concentration is not the antidote to all the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, except for the smallest degree of the summit of existence, which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rdo rje lta bu kho na ni ma yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu kho na ni ma yin par bzhed do //
translated: They do not accept that it is the vajra like concentration itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar spong ba'i lam thams cad nyid de'i gnyen por bzhed de /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar spong ba'i lam thams cad nyid de'i gnyen por bzhed de /
translated: All the paths of abandonment are antidotes to that, up to the vajra like concentration.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang de'i 'phrin las gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir nye ba gnyen po nyid du bzung nas so zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes dang de'i 'phrin las gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir nye ba gnyen po nyid du bzung nas so zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say that since uncontaminated transcendent wisdom and its activity are antidotes, they are called close antidotes.

original: gnyen po brnyes nas bcom gyi ngo bo nyid 'dod rgyal dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: gnyen po brnyes nas bcom gyi ngo bo nyid 'dod rgyal dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that they are destroyed by obtaining the antidote, not by the power of the wish fulfilling jewel or the wish granting cow.

original: shin tu mthar thug pa'i gnyen po brnyes nas bcom ste zhes bya ba ni de'i so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa brnyes pa ston par byed la /
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa'i gnyen po brnyes nas bcom ste zhes bya ba ni de'i so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa brnyes pa ston par byed la /
translated: Obtaining the ultimate antidote destroys them shows that they obtain analytical cessation.

original: phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa brnyes pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa brnyes pa ston par byed de /
translated: The phrase later they become nonarising dharmas shows that they obtain nonanalytical cessation.

original: de lta yin dang ston pa mun pa spangs pa dang yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can nyid du gsal bar byas par 'gyur te so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang ston pa mun pa spangs pa dang yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can nyid du gsal bar byas par 'gyur te so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: In that case, the teacher would be clearly shown to be one who has abandoned darkness and is not subject to complete degeneration, because he has attained analytical cessation.üîΩOthers think this.

original: gzhan de bcom zhes pa 'di nyid kyis so sor brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa thob pa bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan de bcom zhes pa 'di nyid kyis so sor brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa thob pa bshad do //
translated: This very ‚Äúhe has destroyed it‚Äù explains the attainment of analytical and non-analytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa 'ba' zhig thob pa las shin tu bcom pas slar skye zhing 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa 'ba' zhig thob pa las shin tu bcom pas slar skye zhing 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is completely destroyed by attaining analytical cessation alone, it does not arise or occur again.üîΩTherefore, since past and future are not generated from degeneration and the present is directed to cessation, they say that they are not abandoned.

original: de bas na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni nyams pa las mi skye ba'i phyir dang da ltar byung ba ni 'gog pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir spangs pa med do zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni nyams pa las mi skye ba'i phyir dang da ltar byung ba ni 'gog pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir spangs pa med do zhes dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: To dispel that doubt, he said,

original: phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it becomes a dharma that will not arise again.‚Äù

original: ji ltar sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i gnyen po thob pa skyed par byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i gnyen po thob pa skyed par byed la /
translated: It is like the obtaining of an antidote that did not exist previously.

original: de ltar gnyen po thob pa la phyis mi skye ba yod ces pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnyen po thob pa la phyis mi skye ba yod ces pa ste /
translated: Obtaining the antidote, it will not arise again later.

original: gnyen po thob pas bcom pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po thob pas bcom pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It is said that it is destroyed by obtaining the antidote.

original: gzhan dag ni mi shes pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig la de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas shin tu spangs pa mthar phyin par spangs pa la yang kun tu spyod pa 'byung bas khyad par du byed do zhes sems so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mi shes pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig la de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas shin tu spangs pa mthar phyin par spangs pa la yang kun tu spyod pa 'byung bas khyad par du byed do zhes sems so //
translated: Others think that the complete abandonment of the aspect of ignorance is the ultimate abandonment, because the afflicted mind that focuses on it arises again.

original: phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom pa ni /
analyzed: phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom pa ni /
translated: They say that it is destroyed because it becomes a dharma that will not arise again later.

original: ji ltar gzhan rnams kyi yang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa tsam las ni ma yin zhes gzhan dag zer ro //üîΩgnyen po brnyes pas gnas @9a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan rnams kyi yang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa tsam las ni ma yin zhes gzhan dag zer ro // gnyen po brnyes pas gnas @9a * //
translated: It is not merely the abandonment of the affliction that focuses on it, as in the case of others.üîΩObtaining the antidote, the basis is transformed and it becomes a dharma that will not arise again later.

original: yongs su gyur te phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su gyur te phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom pa ste /
translated: It is destroyed.

original: de ltar yang nyon mongs pa skyed pa dang 'gal ba'i skye mched drug gi lam skyed pa'i rkyen dang nyon mongs pa skyed pa'i sa bon gyi skye mched drug skyed pa la 'gal ba nyid dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyirüîΩde'i spang bya nyon mongs pa ldog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i skye mched drug skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yang nyon mongs pa skyed pa dang 'gal ba'i skye mched drug gi lam skyed pa'i rkyen dang nyon mongs pa skyed pa'i sa bon gyi skye mched drug skyed pa la 'gal ba nyid dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir de'i spang bya nyon mongs pa ldog pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i skye mched drug skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, the six sense bases that generate the path that is incompatible with the generation of affliction and the six sense bases that generate the seeds of affliction are incompatible.üîΩBecause perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering manifests, it generates the six sense bases that are the cause for reversing the afflictions that are to be abandoned by that perseverance.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar mngon du gyur pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pa'i sa bon ma lus pa ldog pa'i skye mched drug skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar mngon du gyur pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i kun tu rmongs pa'i sa bon ma lus pa ldog pa'i skye mched drug skyed par byed do //
translated: Similarly, because vajra like concentration manifests, it generates the six sense bases that reverse all the seeds of afflicted and unafflicted ignorance.

original: de skyes pas rten dang sa bon med pa'i phyir phyis kun tu rmongs pa mi skye bar byed do //
analyzed: de skyes pas rten dang sa bon med pa'i phyir phyis kun tu rmongs pa mi skye bar byed do //

original: des na phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur ba'i phyir bcom pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur ba'i phyir bcom pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because they later become phenomena that do not arise at all, they are called destroyed.üîΩSince they obtain the antidote, they become phenomena that do not arise at all.

original: de la yang gnyen po brnyes pas shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom zhes 'di dang mngon par 'brel pas 'ga' zhig ni mi shes pa cung zad kyi gnyen po thob pas de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa bcom yang 'ga' zhig gi
analyzed: de la yang gnyen po brnyes pas shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom zhes 'di dang mngon par 'brel pas 'ga' zhig ni mi shes pa cung zad kyi gnyen po thob pas de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa bcom yang 'ga' zhig gi
translated: Since they are related to this, some obtain the antidote to a small amount of ignorance and destroy the affliction that focuses on that, but at some time the seed exists.

original: tshe sa bon skye ba yod pas bcom ldan 'das ni gnyen po brnyes pas mi shis pa ma lus pa'i sa bon drungs nas phyung ba'i phyir na phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i phyir bcom zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: tshe sa bon skye ba yod pas bcom ldan 'das ni gnyen po brnyes pas mi shis pa ma lus pa'i sa bon drungs nas phyung ba'i phyir na phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i phyir bcom zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn teaches that because he obtains the antidote, he uproots the seed of all ignorance without exception and later they do not arise at all, so he is called the destroyer.üîΩBy what means, in what way and in what object are they destroyed?

original: de yang gang gis ji ltar yul gang du bcom zhe na de bstan pa'i phyir kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang gang gis ji ltar yul gang du bcom zhe na de bstan pa'i phyir kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhes gsungs te /
translated: To explain that, it says, ‚ÄúDarkness is completely destroyed in all.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dis ni shes bya thams cad la mun pa gtan du bcom pas mkhyen no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dis ni shes bya thams cad la mun pa gtan du bcom pas mkhyen no //
translated: This Buddha Bhagavat knows, because He has destroyed the darkness of all objects of knowledge forever.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dis kun la mun pa gtan du bcom zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dis kun la mun pa gtan du bcom zhe na /
translated: Why has this Buddha Bhagavat destroyed the darkness of all objects of knowledge forever?

original: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mun pa mun nag ni gnyen po brnyes pas phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mun pa mun nag ni gnyen po brnyes pas phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir bcom pa'o //
translated: The darkness of all aspects of objects of knowledge has been destroyed by Him, because the antidote having been obtained, it has become the case that they will not arise again.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rang gi don phul du phyin pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs par yang bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rang gi don phul du phyin pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs par yang bshad do //
translated: This also explains the Bhagavat's perfection of his own aim, his perfection of knowledge, and his perfection of abandonment.

original: de la kun la mun bcom zhes pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste shes bya thams cad mkhyen pa la gegs su gyur pa'i mun pa spong ba'i thabs bstan pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa yul thams cad la ma chags ma thogs par 'chad par
analyzed: de la kun la mun bcom zhes pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste shes bya thams cad mkhyen pa la gegs su gyur pa'i mun pa spong ba'i thabs bstan pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa yul thams cad la ma chags ma thogs par 'chad par
translated: Therein, the phrase, He has destroyed the darkness of all objects of knowledge explains the perfection of knowledge, because it teaches the method of abandoning the darkness which is an obstruction to the knowledge of all objects of knowledge. The Bhagavat's knowledge is explained as being unobstructed and unattached to all objects.

original: byed do // kun la @9b mun pa bcom zhes pa 'dis spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang bstan te 'jig rten pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can gyi mi shes pa ma lus par spangs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The phrase having destroyed the darkness in all ways also indicates the perfection of abandonment, because it is impossible for mundane beings to abandon all afflicted ignorance.

original: spangs pa yang phyis skye ba ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa yang phyis skye ba ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandonment is also subsequent non-arising, because the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas engage in non-afflicted ignorance.

original: de dag gi spangs pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi spangs pa ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Their abandonment is not the perfection of abandonment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i spangs pa ni kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir spangs pa phun sum tshogs par rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i spangs pa ni kun tu rmongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad phyis shin tu mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir spangs pa phun sum tshogs par rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Only the abandonment of the TathƒÅgata is established as the perfection of abandonment, because all aspects of confusion are subsequently transformed into dharmas that are absolutely non-arising.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dag kyang shes bya thams cad la phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir gtan rnam pa thams cad du bcom pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dag kyang shes bya thams cad la phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir gtan rnam pa thams cad du bcom pa ma yin na /
translated: If attachment and so on are not completely destroyed in every way, because they are not produced again later with regard to all objects of knowledge,

original: ci'i phyir mi shes pa bcom pa kho na'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi shes pa bcom pa kho na'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa brjod ce na /
translated: why is the Lord praised only in terms of the destruction of ignorance?

original: mi shes pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ignorance is the principal factor.

original: gzhan yang ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is in order to demonstrate the perfection of the Teacher himself.

original: ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa yang thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang 'gro ba 'khor ba'i 'dam nas 'dren par mdzad pa'i sbyor ba ste /üîΩgzhan gyi don la rab tu mi sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: ston pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa yang thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang 'gro ba 'khor ba'i 'dam nas 'dren par mdzad pa'i sbyor ba ste / gzhan gyi don la rab tu mi sbyor ba'am /
translated: The perfection of the Teacher himself is the unobstructed knowledge of everything and the application of leading transmigrating beings out of the swamp of cyclic existence.

original: phyin ci log tu sbyor ba ni bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu sbyor ba ni bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: One who does not apply himself to the welfare of others or who applies himself in error is not a teacher.

original: de la shes bya thams cad mkhyen pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i mun pa bcom par bstan pas ni bcom ldan 'das thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' bar rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de la shes bya thams cad mkhyen pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i mun pa bcom par bstan pas ni bcom ldan 'das thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' bar rtogs par byed do //
translated: The statement that he has destroyed the darkness that is the opposite of the knowledge of all things shows that the Lord has unobstructed knowledge of all things.

original: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa bcom par brjod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa la rab tu sbyor ba yang tshigs su bcad pa'i rkang pa gnyis pa dang rkang pa gsum pas bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa bcom par brjod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa la rab tu sbyor ba yang tshigs su bcad pa'i rkang pa gnyis pa dang rkang pa gsum pas bstan to //
translated: The second and third lines of the verse show that he is applied to the ultimate, because he is not described as destroying the passions of others.

original: yang na rang gi don phul du byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mun pa bcom pa nyid gsungs kyi gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa bcom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na rang gi don phul du byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mun pa bcom pa nyid gsungs kyi gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa bcom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, he is said to destroy the darkness that is the opposite of his own preeminent benefit, but not the passions of others.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang ston pa'i bdag la phan pa phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang ston pa'i bdag la phan pa phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The excellence of his knowledge and the excellence of his abandonment are the preeminence of his benefit for himself.

original: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa bcom pa ma yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang 'dis sgrub par nus pas na mun pa bcom pa nyid bshad do //

analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs par bstan pa'i ched kho nar gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, it is said only in order to demonstrate the abandonment of all passions.

original: gang gi phyir mi shes pa ni @10a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi shes pa ni @10a * //

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan zhing kun tu rmongs pa dang cig shos slar mi skye ba ma yin pas de ltar nyon mongs pa gzhan dang nyon mongs pa thams cad mtshungs par ldan no //

translated: Ignorance is associated with all the passions and secondary passions, and it is not the case that the other passions are not born again in confusion. Thus, the other passions are associated with all the passions.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gnyen po brnyes pas so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gnyen po brnyes pas so //

original: gnyen po brnyes pas bdag la phan pa sgrub pa de ni yul thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mi shes pa'i gnyen po phun sum tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyen po brnyes pas bdag la phan pa sgrub pa de ni yul thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mi shes pa'i gnyen po phun sum tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: The attainment of the antidote for the benefit of oneself is the perfection of the antidote to the non-knowledge of all objects in all ways.

original: yang na bdag la phan pa'i phyir bsgrub pa ni bdag la phan pa sgrub pa ste /üîΩbyang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: yang na bdag la phan pa'i phyir bsgrub pa ni bdag la phan pa sgrub pa ste / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Or else, the establishment for the benefit of oneself is the establishment for one's own benefit.üîΩIt is the entire Bodhisattva path, beginning with the generation of the will to win enlightenment

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar byang chub sems dpa'i lam thams cad nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar byang chub sems dpa'i lam thams cad nyid do //

original: de'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa grub pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa grub pa ni bshad ma thag pa'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of its result is the perfection of the knowledge and the perfection of the abandonment, as just explained.

original: des na bdag la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par bstod nas zhes pa gtan tshigs la gsum pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par bstod nas zhes pa gtan tshigs la gsum pa'o //
translated: Therefore, having praised the perfection of the establishment for one's own benefit, is the third reason.

original: yon tan phul du byung ba brjod pa ni bstod pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan phul du byung ba brjod pa ni bstod pa ste /
translated: The expression of excellent qualities is praise.

original: bstod pa ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i gtan tshigs sam rgyu'o //
analyzed: bstod pa ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i gtan tshigs sam rgyu'o //
translated: Praise is the reason or cause for the perfection of good qualities.

original: yang na bdag la phan pa ni bla na med pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bdag la phan pa ni bla na med pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa ste /
translated: Or else, benefit for oneself is the unexcelled pristine wisdom and abandonment.

original: de sgrub pa ni de rtogs pa dang de thob pa'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: de sgrub pa ni de rtogs pa dang de thob pa'i byed pa ste /

analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs shing rab tu gyur pa thob par byed pa'o //

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba dang 'bras bu thams cad kyang gzhan gyi don nyid yin te /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: khyod kyi bsod nams bsod nams 'bras bu gang lags kun //

analyzed: gzhan gyi don te bdag phyir min zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar na bdag la phan pa sgrub par brjod ce na /

translated: The benefits and fruits of the bodhisattvas' practice for the sake of others are called the practice for the sake of self because they are the fruit of the practice for the sake of self.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang 'dir shes rab yon tan gtso bor gzhan gyi dbang bzung nas //
analyzed: gang 'dir shes rab yon tan gtso bor gzhan gyi dbang bzung nas //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'gro bar 'phrin las bsod nams 'bras bu mi @13a * // zad pa // nye bar bzung ba de rnams gzhan du gyur las bcom ldan gyi //

analyzed: 'gro la yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni don med gyur ma lags //
translated: since it is the transformation of the other.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'god pa nyid la rag go //üîΩyang bcom ldan 'das de nyid la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'god pa nyid la rag go // yang bcom ldan 'das de nyid la zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phun sum tshogs pa ni 'gro ba la bla na med pa'i don sgrub par mdzad pa'o //

original: 'khor ba ni 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang brgal bar dka' ba'i phyir 'dam lta bu yin te zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'di dag gis sam 'dir 'gro ba dag 'khor bas na 'khor ba ste nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'gro ba lnga po'o //

original: kun nas chags pas kun tu chags pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas chags pas kun tu chags pa'am /

original: 'dis chags par byed pas kun tu chags pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis chags par byed pas kun tu chags pa ste /

original: bdag dang bdag gi pa'i srid pa'i gzhi'i ngo bo'i phyir 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi pa'i srid pa'i gzhi'i ngo bo'i phyir 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /

analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i gnas yin bas na brgal bar dka' pa ste /

analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis 'gog pa la skrag pas de las mi brgal pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin pa dang brgal bar dka' ba dag gis na 'khor ba ni 'dam lta bu ste 'dam dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: yang na 'khor ba nas thog ma dang tha ma med ba nas kun tu brgyug cing skad cig kyang mi gnas pa ste /

original: ris mthun pa dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams las sngar skyes pa zhig nas bar ma chad par lus gzhan thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'khor ba ni 'dam dang chos mtshungs pa las 'dam dang 'dra bas na 'dam zhes bya ste /

original: dper na 'dam chus brlan pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas te bying bar byed pa'i bdag @13b nyid yin la /üîΩder bying ba ba lang rgan po la sogs pa rnams kyis rang gi g-yo 'gul dag gis brgal bar dka' ba de bzhin du 'khor ba yang srid pa'i sred pa'i brlan gyi dbang gis 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: dper na 'dam chus brlan pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas te bying bar byed pa'i bdag @13b nyid yin la / der bying ba ba lang rgan po la sogs pa rnams kyis rang gi g-yo 'gul dag gis brgal bar dka' ba de bzhin du 'khor ba yang srid pa'i sred pa'i brlan gyi dbang gis 'gro ba kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /
translated: For example, a swamp is a place of attachment for all beings due to the moisture of water and it has the nature of causing beings to sink.üîΩBeings who sink in a swamp, such as an old cow, are difficult to extricate due to their own movements.

original: bdag la sred pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir brgal dka' ba'o ;
analyzed: bdag la sred pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir brgal dka' ba'o ;
translated: Similarly, samsara is a place of attachment for all beings due to the moisture of craving for existence and it is difficult to extricate due to the practice of craving for the self.

original: / yang na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin ba nye bar len pas de nyid du 'gro ba rnams 'bying bas kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /
analyzed: / yang na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin ba nye bar len pas de nyid du 'gro ba rnams 'bying bas kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /

analyzed: bdag la sred pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir brgal dka' ba ste bsam pa de dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang na sred pa la brten pa'i phyir kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /

analyzed: de las skye ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni brgal dka' ba ste /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni brgal dka' ba ste /

analyzed: de ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba bstan ba dang mnyam pa'i gegs yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang na 'jig tshogs la lta bas de'i 'gog pa la skrag pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis kun tu chags pa'i gnas yin la /

analyzed: de ltar yang /

translated: Or else, all the afflictions are the cause of the world‚Äôs attachment to sa·πÉsƒÅra,

analyzed: dang thar pa khong chud par mi 'gyur bas brgal dka' ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is difficult to cross over.
