original: phyag brkyang ba dang 'dra bas phyag brkyang ba zhes byas nas 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba drangs pa dang 'brel pas 'dam du bying ba 'dren par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis phyag brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: phyag brkyang ba dang 'dra bas phyag brkyang ba zhes byas nas 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba drangs pa dang 'brel pas 'dam du bying ba 'dren par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis phyag brkyang ba'o //
translated: Since it is like an outstretched hand, it is called the outstretched hand. Since it is connected with pulling out those who are sunk in the mud of samsara, the outstretched hand has the nature of pulling out those who are sunk in the mud.

original: mang po'i tshig ni gdul bya'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir te /üîΩspyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni gdul bya'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir te / spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //
translated: The word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is taught in order to show the different types of disciples.üîΩThe aggregates of Dharma were taught

original: chos kyi phung bo mthun par gsungs //
analyzed: chos kyi phung bo mthun par gsungs //
translated: as antidotes to the various behaviors.

original: zhes ji skad gsungs ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad gsungs ba lta bu'o //
translated: As it says.

original: gal te bdag cag la sogs pa rnams 'khor ba na gnas na ji ltar na 'gro ba 'khor ba'i 'dam las drangs she na /
analyzed: gal te bdag cag la sogs pa rnams 'khor ba na gnas na ji ltar na 'gro ba 'khor ba'i 'dam las drangs she na /
translated: If we and others remain in cyclic existence, how can we lead beings out of the swamp of cyclic existence?

original: dogs pa 'di bsal ba'i phyir skal ba ji lta ba bzhin drangs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di bsal ba'i phyir skal ba ji lta ba bzhin drangs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: To dispel this doubt, the verse says that he leads them according to their lot.

original: phyogs can bzhin du phyogs la yang 'dogs pa'i phyir ram 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa'i phyir chos bstan pas 'gro ba 'dren @14b par byed cing 'gro ba ma lus pa 'dren bar spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas de skad brjod
analyzed: phyogs can bzhin du phyogs la yang 'dogs pa'i phyir ram 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa'i phyir chos bstan pas 'gro ba 'dren @14b par byed cing 'gro ba ma lus pa 'dren bar spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas de skad brjod
translated: Or else, he is called a leader because he teaches the Dharma to all beings, like the sun, which is designated as the leader of the directions because it rises in the east and sets in the west, or because it is applied to the leader of all beings, like the sun, which is applied to the leader of the stars.

original: de nyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyi ma bzhin no //
translated: He is like the sun.

original: 'di ltar nyi ma ni padma kha 'byed par nus pa yin yang yongs su smin pa de nyid kha 'byed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyi ma ni padma kha 'byed par nus pa yin yang yongs su smin pa de nyid kha 'byed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the sun is able to open the lotus but cannot open what is not fully ripe,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'gro ba 'dren par spyod pa na gang dag rgyud yongs su smin pa de dag kho na drangs kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'gro ba 'dren par spyod pa na gang dag rgyud yongs su smin pa de dag kho na drangs kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: so the Lord, when he leads beings, leads only those whose mental continua are fully ripe, not others.

original: 'dir brnan pa yang ste gang dang gang skal ba dang ldan pa de dang de drangs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir brnan pa yang ste gang dang gang skal ba dang ldan pa de dang de drangs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, here, those who are fortunate are drawn by the Blessed One, i.e., he causes them to enter.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa yang gang zhig yin ce na /
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa yang gang zhig yin ce na /
translated: Who are the fortunate?

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: Those whose roots of virtue conducive to liberation are mature.

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni rang gis nyes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa mthar phyin pa brnyes pa rnams kyis kyang 'khor ba'i 'dam nas drangs par mi spyod de /
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa rnams ni rang gis nyes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa mthar phyin pa brnyes pa rnams kyis kyang 'khor ba'i 'dam nas drangs par mi spyod de /
translated: Those who are unfortunate are not drawn out of the mire of cyclic existence by the Blessed Buddhas, even though they have attained perfection in the skill of taming sentient beings, because of their own faults.

original: de skad du /üîΩkhyod kyis phyi rol yan lag stobs //
analyzed: de skad du / khyod kyis phyi rol yan lag stobs //
translated: As it is said:üîΩYou have properly accomplished

original: mtha' dag yang dag bsgrubs mod kyi //
analyzed: mtha' dag yang dag bsgrubs mod kyi //
translated: all the external branches of yoga,

original: nang gi bdag nyid stobs bral bas //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid stobs bral bas //
translated: but the inner self is powerless,

original: byis pa rnams ni nyon mongs bsten //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni nyon mongs bsten //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: so childish beings rely on afflictions.

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa nyid ni log ba nyid du nges ba nas thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa dang / ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa nyid ni log ba nyid du nges ba nas thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa dang / ma bstan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams te /
translated: Those who are not fortunate are those who are destined for error, those whose roots of virtue conducive to liberation are not matured, those who are not being taught, and those born in the form and formless realms.

original: der mthong ba'i lam mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der mthong ba'i lam mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path of insight does not arise there.

original: de'i phyir skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kho na phyi dang nang gi phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa drangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba dang ldan pa rnams kho na phyi dang nang gi phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa drangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, only those who are fortunate are led to possess external and internal excellence.

original: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
analyzed: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
translated: Even though the king of the gods sends down rain,

original: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
analyzed: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
translated: a bad seed does not grow.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang //üîΩskal ba med pas 'bras mi myong //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang // skal ba med pas 'bras mi myong //
translated: Even though the Buddhas appear,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: the unfortunate do not experience the fruit.

original: yang na gang zhig rnam pa gang gi skal ba dang ldan pa de de kho nas drangs te /üîΩphung po bstan pa'am /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig rnam pa gang gi skal ba dang ldan pa de de kho nas drangs te / phung po bstan pa'am /
translated: Or else, those who are fortunate in regard to a certain aspect are led by that alone.üîΩBy the teaching of the aggregates,

original: khams dang skye mched dam rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pas so //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched dam rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pas so //
translated: or the elements and sense bases, or dependent origination.

original: des na 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa don dang bcas par ston par byed do //
analyzed: des na 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa don dang bcas par ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, he teaches that the Bhagavat's teaching of the Dharma is meaningful.

original: yang na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin pas sems can rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: yang na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can yin pas sems can rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: Or else, there are three kinds of sentient beings, because they belong to the lineages of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, the pratyekabuddha, and the Buddha.

original: de dag las gang zhig theg pa gang gis drang ba'i skal ba ldan pa de de nyid kyis drang bar bya ste /üîΩ'dis ni bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad la phan @15a * //
analyzed: de dag las gang zhig theg pa gang gis drang ba'i skal ba ldan pa de de nyid kyis drang bar bya ste / 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das sems can thams cad la phan @15a * //
translated: Among them, whoever is fit to be led by whichever vehicle should be led by just that one.

original: 'dogs pa dang / bla na med pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dogs pa dang / bla na med pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the Bhagavat is the unsurpassed spiritual friend who benefits all sentient beings.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mkhas pa gang //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen mkhas pa gang //
translated: The wise spiritual friend

original: gang zhig bag med sdig spyod pa //üîΩnus kyang yon tan gzhan dag la //
analyzed: gang zhig bag med sdig spyod pa // nus kyang yon tan gzhan dag la //
translated: Whoever is heedless and commits evil

original: nges par sbyor ba min pa nyid //üîΩces bshad do //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba min pa nyid // ces bshad do //
translated: Even if able, does not definitely apply himself to other good qualities.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, he is endowed with the perfection of accomplishing the benefit of self and other.

original: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i bstod pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyi sgra ni ji skad bshad pa'i bstod pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is for the purpose of showing the form of praise that has been explained.

original: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs tshogs pa dang ldan pas bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs tshogs pa dang ldan pas bdag la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: He is endowed with the perfection of benefit for himself because he is endowed with the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of wisdom.

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i ston pa po yin pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i ston pa po yin pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: He is endowed with the perfection of benefit for others because he is the teacher of the true Dharma, together with its result.

original: mgos btud nas zhes pa 'dis lus kyi las ston par byed do //
analyzed: mgos btud nas zhes pa 'dis lus kyi las ston par byed do //
translated: By ‚Äúbowing his head,‚Äù he shows the activity of the body.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyis ston pa la mchod pa byas te bstan bcos rtsom mo zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyis ston pa la mchod pa byas te bstan bcos rtsom mo zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having made offerings to the Teacher with body, speech, and mind, he composes the treatise.

original: yang phyag 'tshal ba dag gi las yin pas mgos btud nas zhes ba 'di mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: yang phyag 'tshal ba dag gi las yin pas mgos btud nas zhes ba 'di mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not correct to say ‚Äúbowing his head‚Äù because it is the activity of prostration,

original: mi rigs te phyag 'tshal ba ni lus dang sems kyis 'dus pa yang yin la 'ga' zhig gi tshe dag tu rab tu brtag cing 'ga' zhig gi tshe mgo bo la sogs pa rnams kyis te 'dir ni gus pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs te phyag 'tshal ba ni lus dang sems kyis 'dus pa yang yin la 'ga' zhig gi tshe dag tu rab tu brtag cing 'ga' zhig gi tshe mgo bo la sogs pa rnams kyis te 'dir ni gus pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not incorrect, because prostration is both a coming together of body and mind, and in some cases it is also a bowing of the head and so on, and here it is taught as a special form of respect.

original: phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni mgos btud nas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni mgos btud nas so zhes bshad do //
translated: Having prostrated means having bowed with the head.

original: gang yang 'dud pa'i sgra lan ma zhes sbyar ba na rnam dbye bzhi pa rigs pas 'di nye ba'i tshig gi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba las su nye bar btags ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'dud pa'i sgra lan ma zhes sbyar ba na rnam dbye bzhi pa rigs pas 'di nye ba'i tshig gi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba las su nye bar btags ba ste /
translated: When the word prostration is used in the sense of having bowed, it is the fourth case, the ablative, and it is correctly applied as a near synonym of the seventh case, the dative, because it is a case of action.

original: 'thab pa la go bgo / khyim thab la nyal lo zhes ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa la go bgo / khyim thab la nyal lo zhes ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, having put on armor, and having gone to bed.

original: btud nas kyi sgra ni na ma'i sgra dang mtshungs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: btud nas kyi sgra ni na ma'i sgra dang mtshungs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault because the word having bowed is similar to the word having made obeisance.

original: sbyor ba smos pa las gzhan du yang de'i don nyid la bzhir 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba smos pa las gzhan du yang de'i don nyid la bzhir 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the meaning of having prostrated is the same as the meaning of having bowed, but it is expressed in a different way, that is, as a nominalized verb.

original: don bzhin ston pa zhes bya ba la don gang zhig ji ltar gnas pa de kho na ltar ston gyi gzhan du ma yin pas don bzhin ston pa'o //
analyzed: don bzhin ston pa zhes bya ba la don gang zhig ji ltar gnas pa de kho na ltar ston gyi gzhan du ma yin pas don bzhin ston pa'o //
translated: He teaches the truth, for he teaches just as it is, not otherwise, whatever the case may be.

original: yang na don ji lta ba dang dgos pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul bar byed pas na don bzhin ston ba ste /
analyzed: yang na don ji lta ba dang dgos pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul bar byed pas na don bzhin ston ba ste /
translated: Or else, he teaches the truth because he disciplines just as it is and as is necessary.

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub 'dod pa rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la 'dul ba lta bu ma yin pa ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //üîΩ@15b yang don bzhin ston pa 'di rang dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'i ldog pa nas yin nam ci zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub 'dod pa rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la 'dul ba lta bu ma yin pa ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o // @15b yang don bzhin ston pa 'di rang dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'i ldog pa nas yin nam ci zhe na /
translated: He does not discipline those who desire the enlightenment of a disciple for the enlightenment of a Solitary Buddha, and so on.üîΩIs this teaching of the truth the perfection of the benefit for self and others?

original: 'dis don bzhin ston pa de'i ldog pa nas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis don bzhin ston pa de'i ldog pa nas ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not from the point of view of the perfection of the benefit for self and others.

original: 'on kyang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs 'dis gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs 'dis gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: But it is the means of accomplishing the benefit for others.

original: de la gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs ni snying rje dang ldan pas gzhan dag la dam pa'i chos ston pa ste de ni don bzhin ston pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs ni snying rje dang ldan pas gzhan dag la dam pa'i chos ston pa ste de ni don bzhin ston pa nyid do //
translated: The means of accomplishing benefit for others is teaching the true Dharma to others out of compassion.

original: yang ji ltar na don bzhin ston pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'dir gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs gsal bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na don bzhin ston pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'dir gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs gsal bar byed ce na /
translated: How does the means of accomplishing benefit for others become evident here through teaching in accordance with the truth?

original: de'i phyir de ni ston pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthun cha ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni ston pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs kyi rdzu 'phrul dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthun cha ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that when teaching, one draws beings out of the swamp of cyclic existence by teaching exactly as it is, not by the power of miracles or the gift of the sublime.

original: mthu'i sgra ni nus pa brjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mthu'i sgra ni nus pa brjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The word power expresses ability.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis ma yin dam pa sbyin pas ma yin zhes re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis ma yin dam pa sbyin pas ma yin zhes re re la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied to each, not by miracles, not by the gift of the sublime.

original: gal te yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis rlabs kyi mthus sems can rnams skad cig tsam zhe sdang dang bral ba la sogs par ni 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis rlabs kyi mthus sems can rnams skad cig tsam zhe sdang dang bral ba la sogs par ni 'gyur la /
translated: Even if, through the power of the Tathagata's blessing, sentient beings become free from anger and so on for just a moment,

original: gzhan gyi sems kyang shes mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyang shes mod kyi /
translated: Although they do know the minds of others,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin rlabs kyis de rnams nyon mongs pa spangs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin rlabs kyis de rnams nyon mongs pa spangs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they do not abandon the defilements by the power of the Lord.

original: 'o na ci zhe na dam pa'i chos bstan pa las don rtogs te nyon mongs pa spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na dam pa'i chos bstan pa las don rtogs te nyon mongs pa spong bar byed do //
translated: But they do abandon the defilements by understanding the truth through the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa la rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa la rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis te /
translated: The cause and the condition for the arising of right view are two:

original: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: the voice of another and proper attention.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par 'khor ba'i 'dam dang bral ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par 'khor ba'i 'dam dang bral ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And without the abandonment of the defilements, there is no escape from the mire of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir de ni ston pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni ston pa na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs so //
translated: Therefore, when he teaches, he teaches the truth just as it is, and he leads beings out of the mire of cyclic existence.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Miraculous power is the ability to move through space, etc.

original: dam pa sbyin ba ni dper na dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams kyis srin po'i dbang po sgra sgrogs la sogs pa dag lha la sogs pa rnams kyis gsang par bya ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dam pa sbyin ba ni dper na dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams kyis srin po'i dbang po sgra sgrogs la sogs pa dag lha la sogs pa rnams kyis gsang par bya ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The gift of the holy is like the gift of the lord of the rƒÅk·π£asas, RƒÅva·πáa, to Mahe≈õvara and so on, which is not to be concealed by the gods and so on.

original: gzhan dag mthu ni rdzu 'phrul dang dam pha sbyin pa las logs su 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag mthu ni rdzu 'phrul dang dam pha sbyin pa las logs su 'dod de /
translated: Others assert that power is distinct from the gift of the holy.

original: ji ltar nor bu dang sman gyi mthus rims la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu dang sman gyi mthus rims la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, through the power of jewels and medicine, one is freed from fever and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang rten mi mtshungs pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i @16a * //üîΩgnyen po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang rten mi mtshungs pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i @16a * // gnyen po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the afflictions and their basis are not similar, miracles and so on do not act as antidotes to the afflictions.

original: gang gi tshe rten nad kyi rgyu yin pa de'i tshe rten nyid nang med pa'i rgyur gso dpyad la sogs pa rnams su mthong bas rten tha dad pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rten nad kyi rgyu yin pa de'i tshe rten nyid nang med pa'i rgyur gso dpyad la sogs pa rnams su mthong bas rten tha dad pa mi 'dod do //
translated: When the basis is the cause of illness, it is seen that the basis itself is the cause of the illness, as in the case of medicine and so on. Therefore it is not asserted that the basis is different.

original: de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul mthong yang gnyen po skyes pa med par nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'ga' yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul mthong yang gnyen po skyes pa med par nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'ga' yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Likewise, even though one sees the miracles, one does not see any abandonment of the afflictions without the arising of the antidote.

original: dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by the power of giving the gift of the Dharma,

original: rgyu 'gal ba can rnams la de'i 'bras bu yang 'gal ba can nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyu 'gal ba can rnams la de'i 'bras bu yang 'gal ba can nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: because one sees that the effect of a contradictory cause is contradictory itself.

original: nyon mongs pa spyod pa rnams la rgyu mi 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spyod pa rnams la rgyu mi 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For those who practice the afflictions, there is no non-contradictory cause.

original: dper na mi sdug pa dang mi rtag pa sogs pa bsgom pa la yang man ngag med pa med par de bsgom pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mi sdug pa dang mi rtag pa sogs pa bsgom pa la yang man ngag med pa med par de bsgom pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even if there is no lack of instruction in meditation on the repulsive, impermanence, and so on, there is no meditation on them.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa dag gis ni sems can rnams rangs pa tsam zhig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa dag gis ni sems can rnams rangs pa tsam zhig tu 'gyur na /
translated: By miracles and clairvoyance, beings are merely delighted.

original: rangs pa tsam gyis ni nyon mongs pa spong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rangs pa tsam gyis ni nyon mongs pa spong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But mere delight does not abandon the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yin ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba yod ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yin ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa med par 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba yod ba ma yin te /
translated: Because the afflictions are the root of samsara, without abandoning the afflictions, there is no crossing over the swamp of samsara.

original: de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus 'khor ba'i 'dam las drangs ba med do //üîΩtshigs su bcad pa 'dir ni gzhan gyi ston pa dang bstan pa dang slob ma rnams las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzu 'phrul dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus 'khor ba'i 'dam las drangs ba med do // tshigs su bcad pa 'dir ni gzhan gyi ston pa dang bstan pa dang slob ma rnams las /
translated: Therefore, there is no one who can rescue beings from the swamp of cyclic existence by the power of his miracles and his gift of the holy Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang de'i bstan pa dang de'i slob ma rnams khyad par du 'phags par brjod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang de'i bstan pa dang de'i slob ma rnams khyad par du 'phags par brjod do //
translated: In this verse, the Blessed One and his Dharma and his disciples are shown to be superior to other teachers, their teachings, and their disciples.

original: spangs pa dang rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa dang rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is endowed with the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of realization, because his teaching is the means for crossing over the swamp of cyclic existence, and because he has crossed over the swamp of cyclic existence himself.

original: gzhan dag ni ston par khas blangs par zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ston par khas blangs par zad kyi /
translated: Others are merely acknowledged as teachers,

original: spangs pa dang rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: spangs pa dang rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la /
translated: but they are not endowed with the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of realization.

original: de dag gis bstan pa ni 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag gis bstan pa ni 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba'i thabs ma yin zhing /
translated: Their teachings are not the means for crossing over the swamp of cyclic existence,üîΩand they have not crossed over the swamp of cyclic existence themselves.

original: de dag gi slob ma rnams kyang 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba ma yin no zhes don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi slob ma rnams kyang 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba ma yin no zhes don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: and their disciples are not liberated from the mire of cyclic existence.

original: yang na bstan pa ni rten dang rgyu dang brjod bya dang gnas dang dgos pa'i khyad par bstan pas gzhan gyi bstan pa las khyad par 'phags par bshad de /
analyzed: yang na bstan pa ni rten dang rgyu dang brjod bya dang gnas dang dgos pa'i khyad par bstan pas gzhan gyi bstan pa las khyad par 'phags par bshad de /
translated: Alternatively, the teaching is explained as superior to other teachings because it teaches the distinctions of basis, cause, content, location, and purpose.

original: de la brten ni phyin na gshegs pa'i bstan pa la sems can rnams mngon par dad pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten ni phyin na gshegs pa'i bstan pa la sems can rnams mngon par dad pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis is the teaching of the one who has gone, i.e., the Buddha, in order to generate faith in sentient beings.

original: rgyu ni thams cad du thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes @16b dang bla na med pa'i spangs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: rgyu ni thams cad du thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes @16b dang bla na med pa'i spangs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The cause is the Bhagavat, who possesses unobstructed knowledge and unsurpassed abandonment.

original: brjod bya ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod bya ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The content is the unmistaken meaning, such as suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: gnas ni 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnas ni 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba rnams so //
translated: The location is those who are mired in the mire of cyclic existence.

original: dgos pa ni sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'dam nas 'dren pa'o ;
analyzed: dgos pa ni sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'dam nas 'dren pa'o ;
translated: The purpose is to liberate sentient beings from the mire of cyclic existence.

original: / yang na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: / yang na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the perfection of knowledge, the perfection of abandonment, and the perfection of benefit for others.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu nyid kyi bstan pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu nyid kyi bstan pa phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu nyid do //
translated: It is the sole teacher of the three worlds, because it is the sole unmistaken teaching of the three worlds.

original: yang na kun tu mun bcom zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na kun tu mun bcom zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, it is called the destroyer of all darkness,

original: ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir te /
translated: because its knowledge is unobstructed.

original: sems can rnams kyi tshe rabs 'di dang phyi ma dang nges par legs par ma lus ba'i don byed nus pa la bshad do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi tshe rabs 'di dang phyi ma dang nges par legs par ma lus ba'i don byed nus pa la bshad do //
translated: It is explained that it is able to accomplish the benefit of all sentient beings in this life, the next life, and in the definite good.

original: mun pa gtan bcom zhes pa 'dis ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mun pa gtan bcom zhes pa 'dis ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This line ‚Äúthe destroyer of all darkness‚Äù shows that there is no occurrence of attachment and aversion.

original: gzhan gyi don mthar phyin pa'i rgyu ni gzhan gyi don mthar phyin pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don mthar phyin pa'i rgyu ni gzhan gyi don mthar phyin pa'i thabs so //
translated: The cause of the completion of the benefit of others is the means for the completion of the benefit of others.

original: yang na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rjes su dpag pa dang bcas pa yongs su gsal bar bstan /
analyzed: yang na ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rjes su dpag pa dang bcas pa yongs su gsal bar bstan /
translated: Or else, the perfect wisdom and the perfect abandonment are fully revealed along with the inference.

original: don bzhin ston pa nyid kyis ye shes phun sum tshogs pa rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: don bzhin ston pa nyid kyis ye shes phun sum tshogs pa rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: The perfect wisdom is to be inferred from the teaching of reality itself.

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'dam nas 'byin pas spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'dam nas 'byin pas spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfect abandonment is the deliverance of beings from the swamp of cyclic existence.

original: gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba de'i phyir 'gro ba 'dren par nus pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i 'dam las brgal ba de'i phyir 'gro ba 'dren par nus pa'o //
translated: Because he has crossed over the swamp of cyclic existence, he is able to lead the world.

original: 'dam gyi gnas dang 'dra bas 'dam du bying ba'o //
analyzed: 'dam gyi gnas dang 'dra bas 'dam du bying ba'o //
translated: The swamp is like a place of mud, so one sinks in the mud.

original: yang na rtogs pa mthar phyin pa dang spangs ba mthar phyin pa dang gzhan la phan pa mthar phyin pa dang gzhan la phan par byed pa'i thabs mthar phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa mthar phyin pa dang spangs ba mthar phyin pa dang gzhan la phan pa mthar phyin pa dang gzhan la phan par byed pa'i thabs mthar phyin pa rnams so //
translated: Or else, the perfect wisdom is the perfection of realization, the perfect abandonment is the perfection of abandonment, the perfection of benefit for others is the perfection of the means of benefiting others.

original: de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes gsungs pa la byed pa po mtshungs pa'i bya ba gnyis kyis snga ma'i dus kyi bya ba la nas zhes pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes gsungs pa la byed pa po mtshungs pa'i bya ba gnyis kyis snga ma'i dus kyi bya ba la nas zhes pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Having paid homage to him is to be supplied from the previous verse. The word having indicates the prior completion of the action of paying homage, by the same agent.

original: dper na khrus byas nas za zhes pa lta bu'o //üîΩde'i phyir bya ba gzhan la bltos pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: dper na khrus byas nas za zhes pa lta bu'o // de'i phyir bya ba gzhan la bltos pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: For example, the expression having bathed, he eats indicates that the action of eating follows after the action of bathing.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the word having is used to indicate that the action of composing the treatise follows after the action of paying homage.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The master has also said, I will explain the treatise.

original: slob ma mchod pa'i phyir dang slob ma 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos so //
analyzed: slob ma mchod pa'i phyir dang slob ma 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos so //
translated: The treatise is for the sake of worshipping the disciples and for the sake of disciplining the disciples.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /üîΩphan pa 'thob pa'i rgyu dang mi phan pa spong ba'i rgyu dag gis yang dag par @17a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te / phan pa 'thob pa'i rgyu dang mi phan pa spong ba'i rgyu dag gis yang dag par @17a * //
translated: This is what is being said:üîΩI will explain the treatise for the sake of those who wish to attain benefit and for the sake of those who wish to abandon harm.

original: rjes su 'chos pa dang nyes pa dang sdug bsngal rnams las skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos su bshad de /
analyzed: rjes su 'chos pa dang nyes pa dang sdug bsngal rnams las skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos su bshad de /
translated: The treatise is explained in order to protect from faults and suffering.

original: phan pa dang mi phan pa 'thob pa dang spong pa'i rgyur gyur pa dag gis rjes su 'chos pa dang nyes pa dang sdug bsngal rnams las skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos so ;
analyzed: phan pa dang mi phan pa 'thob pa dang spong pa'i rgyur gyur pa dag gis rjes su 'chos pa dang nyes pa dang sdug bsngal rnams las skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos so ;
translated: It is a treatise because it teaches the causes of obtaining benefit and avoiding harm, and it protects from faults and suffering.

original: / bstan bcos aa to n+ya th'a de yang gsal bar bya ba'am rab tu dbye bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes so //
analyzed: / bstan bcos aa to n+ya th'a de yang gsal bar bya ba'am rab tu dbye bar bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes so //
translated: The treatise is called Abhidharmako≈õa because it illuminates or it classifies that Abhidharma.

original: du ma nyid bcad pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa la chos mngon mdzod ces te /
analyzed: du ma nyid bcad pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa la chos mngon mdzod ces te /
translated: It is called Abhidharmako≈õa in order to eliminate the notion that it is multiple.

original: chos mngon pa smos pa ni 'dul ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos mngon pa smos pa ni 'dul ba la sogs pa'i bstan bcos rnam par bcad pa'i don to //
translated: The term abhidharma eliminates the notion that it is a treatise on vinaya and so on.

original: mdzod smos ba ni chos mngon pa'i bsdus pa'i ngo bo shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzod smos ba ni chos mngon pa'i bsdus pa'i ngo bo shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ko≈õa is stated in order to understand the nature of the compendium of abhidharma.

original: ci'i phyir 'di brtsams she na chos mngon pa rgyas ba bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di brtsams she na chos mngon pa rgyas ba bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why was it composed? It was composed in order to compile the extensive abhidharma.

original: da lta yin dang bya ba du mas sems g-yeng ba dang blo zhen pa rnams rjes su gzung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da lta yin dang bya ba du mas sems g-yeng ba dang blo zhen pa rnams rjes su gzung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, by means of many activities, he will be able to hold the attention of those whose minds are distracted and whose thoughts are scattered.

original: de la gang la bstod pa dang ji ltar dang gang gi don du bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: de la gang la bstod pa dang ji ltar dang gang gi don du bstod pa tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstan to //
translated: In this regard, the verse shows who is praised, how he is praised, and for what purpose he is praised.

original: chos mngon pa mdzod ces brjod pa ni tshig bsdus pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir gnyis dam bcas bar 'gyur te chos mngon pa dang mdzod do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod ces brjod pa ni tshig bsdus pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir gnyis dam bcas bar 'gyur te chos mngon pa dang mdzod do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúabhidharmako≈õa‚Äù is a dvandva compound, because it is a member of a tatpurusa compound.

original: chos mngon pa dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir mngon pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir mngon pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since the Abhidharma is specified, the question is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is this that is called Abhidharma?‚Äù

original: yan lag gi don de dmigs kyis bkar na tshig bsdu ba'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag gi don de dmigs kyis bkar na tshig bsdu ba'i don bde blag tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the meaning of the member is specified, the meaning of the compound is easily understood.

original: chos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas //
analyzed: chos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas //
translated: Abhidharma is stainless wisdom together with its following.

original: zhes bya ba la shes rab smos ba ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la shes rab smos ba ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The expression ‚Äústainless wisdom‚Äù is used because wisdom is the principal factor.

original: chos mngon pa ni phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir shes rab kho na chos mngon ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa ni phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir shes rab kho na chos mngon ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The Abhidharma is not just wisdom, because it is said, ‚ÄúThe Abhidharma is the five aggregates.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rnam par phye ste rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rnam par phye ste rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The discernment of phenomena is the discernment of phenomena after they have been differentiated, the understanding of their specific and general characteristics.

original: dri med ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir te don dam pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri med ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir te don dam pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äústainless‚Äù is used to distinguish it from that which is contaminated, because it is the ultimate that is intended here.

original: dri ma rnams ni zag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni zag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is said to be ‚Äúwithout contaminants‚Äù because contaminants are synonyms for stains.

original: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa zag pa rnams rgyas bar mi 'gyur bas na zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la sogs pa zag pa rnams rgyas bar mi 'gyur bas na zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without contaminants because the contaminants, such as attachment, do not increase in it.

original: yang ci shes rab dri ma med pa kho na chos mngon pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci shes rab dri ma med pa kho na chos mngon pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is only stainless wisdom the Abhidharma?

original: smras pa @17b ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa @17b ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rjes 'brang bcas so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rjes 'brang bcas so //
translated: What is it then? It is the Abhidharma together with its following.

original: rjes su 'brang ba yang shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba yang shes rab gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: The following is also wisdom, because wisdom is predominant.

original: yang shes rab 'khor ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang shes rab 'khor ni ma yin no //
translated: The retinue of wisdom is not the same.

original: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa dang dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag dang dge ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs la sogs pa dang dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag dang dge ba nyid kyis shes rab kyi rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: The retinue of wisdom is the form aggregate, etc., time, effect, etc., and virtue, which are engaged by wisdom.

original: de ni shes rab kyi 'khor ro //üîΩde la mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan dang bsam gtan khyad par can la brten pa'i shes rab la ni gang gis gang de skad du bshad pa yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho bas bsdus pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi 'khor ro // de la mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan dang bsam gtan khyad par can la brten pa'i shes rab la ni gang gis gang de skad du bshad pa yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho bas bsdus pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i
translated: This is the retinue of wisdom.

original: gzugs kyang rjes su 'jug pa yong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyang rjes su 'jug pa yong ngo //
translated: In the wisdom that is based on the stage of unrestricted access to the first meditative stabilization and the special meditative stabilization, the form aggregate is engaged by the unmanifest form that is included in right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: de ltar zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la chos mngon pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la chos mngon pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the five uncontaminated aggregates are taught to be the subject matter of the Abhidharma.

original: gzugs med pa gsum la brten pa'i chos mngon pa ni phung po bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum la brten pa'i chos mngon pa ni phung po bzhi ste /
translated: The subject matter of the Abhidharma that is based on the three formless states is the four aggregates.

original: de ltar de ni phung po lnga las yin zhing de nyid zag pa med pa'i shes rab rjes 'brang bcas pa chos mngon pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de ni phung po lnga las yin zhing de nyid zag pa med pa'i shes rab rjes 'brang bcas pa chos mngon pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the five aggregates, and it is the uncontaminated wisdom together with its following that is Abhidharma.

original: gal te sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir sems nyid gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: gal te sems las byung ba thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir sems nyid gtso bo yin te /
translated: If mind is the principal factor, since it is the basis of all mental factors,

original: de'i phyir de nyid dri ma med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa chos mngon pa yin la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid dri ma med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa chos mngon pa yin la rag mod ce na /
translated: then it is mind itself, together with its following, that is Abhidharma.

original: bya ba dang mthong ba dang dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab kho na rjes 'brang dang bcas pa la chos mngon pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bya ba dang mthong ba dang dmigs pa mngon par rtogs pa la nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir shes rab kho na rjes 'brang dang bcas pa la chos mngon pa zhes brjod do //
translated: But wisdom is called Abhidharma together with its following because it is the power that realizes the object, seeing, and the object, the observed.

original: bya ba mngon par rtogs pa nyid ni gzugs dang rigs la sogs pa rnams mthong bas cig shos sems la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes don 'di la sems ni ma yin gyi shes rab gtso bor yod do //
analyzed: bya ba mngon par rtogs pa nyid ni gzugs dang rigs la sogs pa rnams mthong bas cig shos sems la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes don 'di la sems ni ma yin gyi shes rab gtso bor yod do //
translated: The realization of the object is the power to see form, type, and so on, and the realization of the object is the power to see the other mental factors and so on. Thus wisdom is the principal factor in this context, not mind.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa gang la dmigs nas gnas thob pa ni gnas rnyed pa ste zag bcas de rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa gang la dmigs nas gnas thob pa ni gnas rnyed pa ste zag bcas de rnams so //

original: gnas thob pa ni rang gi rgyud la gnas so zhes 'di ltar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas thob pa ni rang gi rgyud la gnas so zhes 'di ltar bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: 'di yang 'gog pa dang lam dag la mtshungs so zhe na nye bar ma bcom pa ni gnas par mthong ba bzhin no //

original: lta ba la sogs pa la dmigs pas ni de la gnas thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa la dmigs pas ni de la gnas thob pa ma yin no //

analyzed: au pa gh'a ta ya la sogs pas kyang 'gog pa dang lam dag la mtshungs so zhe na 'di ni gnas pa'i don ma yin no //
translated: Reply: This is not the meaning of ‚Äúbasis.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na bdag tu lta ba dang sred pas bdag gir byas pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni nges par gnas thob pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na bdag tu lta ba dang sred pas bdag gir byas pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni nges par gnas thob pa'i don to //

original: de'i phyir 'gog pa @26b dang lam dag ni des bdag gir ma byas shing de la ma dmigs pas de la nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnas thob pa ma yin zhes brjod par bya'o //

translated: Therefore, because the truths of cessation and path are not appropriated by that and are not its object, it should be said that the afflictions do not obtain a basis in them.

original: kha cig na re nyon mongs pa rjes mthun pa la phra rgyas kyi don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re nyon mongs pa rjes mthun pa la phra rgyas kyi don to zhes zer ro //

analyzed: dang gi sgra ni bsdu pa'i don to //

analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rnam gsum kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to /

analyzed: gal te chos rab tu rnam par phye bas nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos de dag kho na bstan par bya ba yin nam /

analyzed: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag ni ma yin no zhe na /

original: de gnyis bden pa'i khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa rnam par phye ba ni nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i thabs ma yin mod kyi /

original: de ltar yin yang zag pa med pa'i chos kyi zhar la zag pa med pa thams cad nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar yin yang zag pa med pa'i chos kyi zhar la zag pa med pa thams cad nye bar bstan to //

analyzed: de dag zag pa rgyas par mi 'gyur ba ni gnas mi thob bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They do not increase the contaminants because they do not obtain a basis.

original: 'dus ma byas ni brjod bya nyung bas de bstan pa'i mjug thogs su bshad par brtsam ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni brjod bya nyung bas de bstan pa'i mjug thogs su bshad par brtsam ste /

analyzed: brjod bya mang ba'i phyir 'dus byas ni ma yin pa nyid do //

analyzed: zhes so // nam mkha' ni 'jig rten na yang rab tu grags pas sngar smos so //

original: 'gog pa gnyis ni 'gar yang ma grags te /
analyzed: 'gog pa gnyis ni 'gar yang ma grags te /

original: de nyid kyi phyir de gnyis gang zhe na zhes smras so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de gnyis gang zhe na zhes smras so //

original: de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response to that question, the root text states, ‚ÄúSpace is the absence of contact.‚Äù

original: de la ni 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum la'o //üîΩde la mi sgrib pa la dngos po dang thogs pa med pa thams cad kyang nam mkha' nyid du thal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ni 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum la'o // de la mi sgrib pa la dngos po dang thogs pa med pa thams cad kyang nam mkha' nyid du thal ba'i phyir /
translated: The term ‚Äúcontact‚Äù refers to the three unconditioned entities.

original: mi sgrib pa ni sgrib pa med pa tsa ma yin pa sgrib pa las gzhan ba dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi sgrib pa ni sgrib pa med pa tsa ma yin pa sgrib pa las gzhan ba dag kyang ma yin no //
translated: Since everything that is not an obstruction or an impingement would be space, the absence of obstruction is not simply the mere absence of obstruction.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rang bzhin gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rang bzhin gyi khyad par te /

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin te zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúthe intrinsic nature of the absence of obstruction.‚Äù

original: sgrib pa ni sgrib pa yin @28b la ;
analyzed: sgrib pa ni sgrib pa yin @28b la ;
translated: Obstruction is that which obstructs.

original: 'di ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas sgrib pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas sgrib pa med pa ste /
translated: Since this is the intrinsic nature of the absence of obstruction, it is the absence of obstruction.

original: sgrib pa'i 'gal zla'i chos te don ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i 'gal zla'i chos te don ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is a quality that is the opposite of obstruction, just as non-meaning is the opposite of meaning.

original: dgag pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi don yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgag pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi don yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term ‚Äúabsence‚Äù is a negation that is defined as the opposite of the object that is being negated.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin yod pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //

analyzed: yang na 'di mi sgrib pa'i rang bzhin yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te / 'di la sgrib par byed pa yang //
translated: Or else, the phrase ‚Äúbecause it has the nature of non-obstruction‚Äù is a compound.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause it does not obstruct‚Äù is a compound.

original: zhes pa rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ram 'brel pa can brjod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ram 'brel pa can brjod par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as a statement of the nature of the dependent, or as a statement of the nature of the dependent in terms of its nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi dbang du byas pa gang dang 'brel pa can nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa de dang de las pra ti siddhe te na su na de bam nam mkha'i rang bzhin bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas pa gang dang 'brel pa can nyid kyi phyir sgrib pa de dang de las pra ti siddhe te na su na de bam nam mkha'i rang bzhin bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because it is dependent on that, and because it is related to that, it is called ‚Äúprati-siddhi,‚Äù and it is explained to have the nature of space.

original: tshig le'ur byas par yang tshig don gzhan gtso bor brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas par yang tshig don gzhan gtso bor brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la thal par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la thal par yang 'gyur te /
translated: It would also be a consequence that feelings, etc., are space,üîΩbecause there is no obstruction of those by those.

original: de rnams la de rnams kyi sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs zer /
analyzed: de rnams la de rnams kyi sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs zer /
translated: This is what Master ƒÄryabhadra says.

original: rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bo ste rang bzhin med pa ldog pas go skabs yod pa gang las de sgrib pa med pa 'di'i rang bzhin zhes 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar ba la mtshan nyid ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bo ste rang bzhin med pa ldog pas go skabs yod pa gang las de sgrib pa med pa 'di'i rang bzhin zhes 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar ba la mtshan nyid ma brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nature is essence. Since the absence of nature is the opposite of that, it is possible to understand that the absence of obscuration is its nature. Here, the word ‚Äúits‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe absence of obscuration‚Äù is not stated in the compound.

analyzed: de'i phyir tshig rnam par sbyar ba 'di la sgrib pa med pa 'di'i rang bzhin zhes 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this compound, the word ‚Äúits‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe absence of obscuration‚Äù is stated as follows.

analyzed: 'dir tshig rnam par sbyar ba 'ga' zhig gi khyad par las don la khyad par med do //
translated: Here, in some compounds, there is no difference in meaning due to a difference in the compound.

original: tshig le'ur byas par gang gsungs pa tshig don gzhan gtso bor brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni gnyi ga la mtshungs so //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas par gang gsungs pa tshig don gzhan gtso bor brjod par bya'o zhes pa ni gnyi ga la mtshungs so //
translated: What is stated in the verse is that the meaning of the words should be expressed primarily as something else. This is the same for both.

original: yang dngos po'i rang bzhin las don gzhan shes par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dngos po'i rang bzhin las don gzhan shes par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is stated in order to make known that the meaning is different from the nature of things.

original: gang yang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la thal bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la thal bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa de yang mi rigs te /

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin gyi /

analyzed: nyams su myong ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni gang zhig sgrib pa med pa nyid rang bzhin te nam mkha'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang ni gang zhig sgrib pa med pa nyid rang bzhin te nam mkha'o zhes zer te /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says that space is by nature the mere absence of obstruction,

original: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because the term ‚Äúunobstructed‚Äù means not being pervaded by the collection of elements and derivative form.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dzin pa thams @29a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dzin pa thams @29a * //
translated: It is not that space is the absence of obstruction in some places,

original: cad du yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: cad du yod pa nyid kyi phyir /

original: gal te de ni nam mkhar mi 'gyur te de la bum pa la sogs pa mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de ni nam mkhar mi 'gyur te de la bum pa la sogs pa mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: mi sgrib pa ni rang gi yul du gzugs skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: mi sgrib pa ni rang gi yul du gzugs skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnonobstruction‚Äù is that it does not obstruct the arising of form in its own place.

original: gal te gegs mi byed na gzugs gnyis pa ci'i phyir dar thogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te gegs mi byed na gzugs gnyis pa ci'i phyir dar thogs par byed ce na /
translated: If it does not obstruct, why does it obstruct the arising of a second form?

original: de ni nam mkhas thogs par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni nam mkhas thogs par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Space does not obstruct.

original: 'o na ci zhe na der gnas pa'i gzugs gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na der gnas pa'i gzugs gzhan gyis so //
translated: What then? It is the other form that is located there.

original: gzhan du na de dang bral yang thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de dang bral yang thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even when it is separated from form, space would be obstructed.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa'i 'bangs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: ƒÄryƒÅsanga says:

original: 'di la yang rnam par bshad par tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la thal bar 'gyur zhes pa 'di yang snga ma kho na slar brjod pa yin pas 'di'i mtha' nges par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang rnam par bshad par tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la thal bar 'gyur zhes pa 'di yang snga ma kho na slar brjod pa yin pas 'di'i mtha' nges par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, the same objection applies to feeling and so on, as was previously stated. Therefore, its conclusion should be taught.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid du med pas nam mkha'o zhes pa'i tshig gis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid du med pas nam mkha'o zhes pa'i tshig gis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It is space because it does not exist as form. This should be understood from the words of the commentary.

original: gang na gzugs kyi go yod pa'o zhes bya bas ni bya ba'i sgo nas kyang 'di yod pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang na gzugs kyi go yod pa'o zhes bya bas ni bya ba'i sgo nas kyang 'di yod pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: It is also shown to exist by the statement, ‚ÄúIt is where form can be located.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi ni yul la gnas pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu skye ba go mi 'byed pa mi rnyed par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin te yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ni yul la gnas pa'i phyir yul gzhan dag tu skye ba go mi 'byed pa mi rnyed par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin te yul la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form is located in space, it is not found to be generated in other locations, but not by other elements, because they are not located in space.

original: de'i phyir gzugs nyid la de skad bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs nyid la de skad bshad do //

original: 'dir ni phung po'i gzugs yongs su gzung gi skye mched kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni phung po'i gzugs yongs su gzung gi skye mched kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the form of the aggregates is meant, not the form of the sense bases.

original: de ltar na 'dir nam mkha' ni rang gi ngo bo dang bya ba'i sgo nas bshad pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir nam mkha' ni rang gi ngo bo dang bya ba'i sgo nas bshad pa byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, here space is explained in terms of its own nature and its function.

analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan gzhi ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcessation due to deliberation‚Äù indicates the basis of the characteristic.

original: gang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa rnams rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas mtshan nyid bshad de /
analyzed: gang bral ba'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa rnams rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas mtshan nyid bshad de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is separation‚Äù explains the characteristic by excluding the arising, the meditative attainment, the impermanence, and the cessation not due to deliberation.

original: de rnams bral ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de rnams bral ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that this is because those are not the nature of separation.

original: 'gog pa gzhan rnams ni 'dir thal ba med de so sor brtags pas 'gog pa smos pa'i phyir zhes pa 'di la bsam pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi bral ba gang yin pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa gzhan rnams ni 'dir thal ba med de so sor brtags pas 'gog pa smos pa'i phyir zhes pa 'di la bsam pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi bral ba gang yin pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that any separation from contaminated phenomena is not cessation through analysis.

original: zag pa med pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zag bcas smos te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zag bcas smos te /
translated: Contaminated is mentioned in order to distinguish from uncontaminated states,

original: de rnams ni spang bya dang kun sbyor dang 'ching ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni spang bya dang kun sbyor dang 'ching ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because those are not objects to be abandoned, nor are they connections or bonds.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'gal zla @29b thar pa dang mi 'dra bar ldan pa las so //
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'gal zla @29b thar pa dang mi 'dra bar ldan pa las so //
translated: Separation is from the possession of their opposites, liberation, which is not similar.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di yang ci nyon mongs pa dang phra rgyas she na /
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di yang ci nyon mongs pa dang phra rgyas she na /
translated: What is possession? Is it the affliction or the negative tendency?

original: bstan bcos su ji skad bshad pa gang zag gang gi phra rgyas gang dngos po gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba de gang zag de phra rgyas de dang dngos bo de ldan par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos su ji skad bshad pa gang zag gang gi phra rgyas gang dngos po gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba de gang zag de phra rgyas de dang dngos bo de ldan par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the treatise, it is explained that any negative tendency that increases in any person with regard to any object is said to be possessed by that person.

original: de'i phyir phra rgyas gnas pa'i mtshan nyid phra rgyas dngos po la ldan pa de 'gal zla'i chos zag bcas kyi chos rnams dang mi ldan ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phra rgyas gnas pa'i mtshan nyid phra rgyas dngos po la ldan pa de 'gal zla'i chos zag bcas kyi chos rnams dang mi ldan ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the presence of negative tendencies is the possession of negative tendencies that are things, and the non-possession of contaminated phenomena that are incompatible with them.

original: gang zag gi ldan pa'am gang zag gi mi ldan pa yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gi ldan pa'am gang zag gi mi ldan pa yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is there possession or non-possession of persons?

original: rten gang la gang zag tu brjod pa'i rgyud la ldan pa'am mi ldan pa'i thob pa mngon du gyur pa la ldan pa'am mi ldan pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par bya'o //

translated: It should be posited that the manifestation of obtainment that is present in the continuum of the basis called a person is possession, and the non-manifestation of obtainment is non-possession.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi thob ba ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi thob ba ni ldan pa'o //
translated: Or, the obtainment of afflicted phenomena is possession.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa gang yang rung ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa yang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa gang yang rung ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa yang ldan pa'o //
translated: The obtainment of any afflicted or unafflicted contaminated phenomenon and the obtainment of any affliction that focuses on an afflicted phenomenon is also possession.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i spangs pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang ldan pa'i lhag ma kun tu 'gro ba dang / sngar spangs pa'i rnam pa dang lhag ma de'i yul gyi dri ma rnams dang de'i thob pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang mi 'dra ba'i chos can gyi phyir mi ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o //üîΩyang ci ltar 'di dang nye ba ma yin pa de thob pa dang lhan cig nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi thob pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i spangs pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang ldan pa'i lhag ma kun tu 'gro ba dang / sngar spangs pa'i rnam pa dang lhag ma de'i yul gyi dri ma rnams dang de'i thob pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang mi 'dra ba'i chos can gyi phyir mi ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o // yang ci ltar 'di dang nye ba ma yin pa de thob pa dang lhan cig nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi thob pa skye zhe na /
translated: The remaining pervasive and prior abandoned aspects and the stains of their objects and their obtainment are said to be nonassociated because they are not similar to contaminated phenomena.üîΩObjection: Why is it that the obtainment of these phenomena and the obtainment of contaminated phenomena arise simultaneously?

original: de ltar byas nas mi ldan par byed pas sam 'di las thob pas na mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas mi ldan par byed pas sam 'di las thob pas na mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Reply: Because it is not associated with that, it is nonassociated.

original: 'dis bral bar byed pa dang bral bas bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis bral bar byed pa dang bral bas bral ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not disassociated because it is disassociated from this.

original: de ltar byed na ni las dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi thob pa dang bral ba tsam la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //

original: ma yin la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma yin la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It continues, ‚ÄúIt is not a cause of that.‚Äù

analyzed: 'dir ni rgyu'i sgra mi mngon par byas pas 'dra ba'i rgyu nyid la 'dra ba zhes brjod de /

analyzed: skal ba bkag pa dang 'dra ba bkag pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'gog pa'i rnam pa gcig nyid kyang spang bya nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis so so so sor mngon du byed de /

analyzed: 'o na spangs pa du ma thob par byed de /
