analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i bdag nyid kho na 'gog par byed pa de'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas @31b sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kho na dang bral ba nyid thob la kun 'byung mthong ba la sogs spang bya rnams la ma yin no //
translated: If one were to stop the very self that is separated from all defilements, then one would obtain separation from only those defilements to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering through perseverance for knowledge of the truth of suffering, but not from those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and so on.

original: yod pa ma yin pa tsam gyis 'gog pa nyon mongs pa rnams bral ba dang ldan pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa tsam gyis 'gog pa nyon mongs pa rnams bral ba dang ldan pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the mere absence of existence would be separation from defilements and that separation would not be possessed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask what is it,

original: de la thob pa gang dang gang lam gyis thob pa de dang des nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid du rnam par mi 'jog gi spang bya'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de la thob pa gang dang gang lam gyis thob pa de dang des nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid du rnam par mi 'jog gi spang bya'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Whatever attainment is attained by a path, it is not established as the mere separation from the affliction by that attainment, but it is established as the mere separation from the object of abandonment that is the affliction.

original: ji ltar na 'dir lam bsgom pa don med pa nyid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dir lam bsgom pa don med pa nyid ce na /
translated: How is it that cultivating the path here is pointless?

original: gang yang bshad pa de dang de ni phul du byung ba dgag pa rab tu gyur pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang bshad pa de dang de ni phul du byung ba dgag pa rab tu gyur pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Whatever is explained is the negation of excellence, which is the aspect of transformation.

original: ci ltar yang der skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur thal ba ni dge ba zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar yang der skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur thal ba ni dge ba zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that the uncontaminated is a homogeneous cause because it is uncontaminated virtue.

original: lam bzhin du 'di las ma lhung ba'i phyir dgag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lam bzhin du 'di las ma lhung ba'i phyir dgag par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be negated like the path because it does not fall from that.

original: skal ba mnyam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyur ni thal ba ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyur ni thal ba ma yin pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Nonhomogeneous means it is not tenable that it is a cause of others.

original: de dgag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dgag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not negated.

original: rgyu'i gtan tshigs ni khas blang bar bya ba nyid ces pa ste 'on kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i gtan tshigs ni khas blang bar bya ba nyid ces pa ste 'on kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for the cause is that it is accepted, but it is virtue.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyur thal ba yang 'di la med de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyur thal ba yang 'di la med de /
translated: Nor is there the absurd consequence that it is a cause of karmic maturation,

original: dge ba zag pa med pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa med pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not virtuous or uncontaminated.

original: lam bzhin yin pa nyid de'i tshe skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thal ba yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: lam bzhin yin pa nyid de'i tshe skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thal ba yang med pa nyid de /
translated: If it is like the path, then there is also the absurd consequence that it is not a homogeneous cause,

original: skyes pa'i thog ma med pa'i phyir dang sas ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i thog ma med pa'i phyir dang sas ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at the beginning of the generation of the first moment and it is not subsumed by the levels.

original: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags ba ma yin pa'i 'gog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags ba ma yin pa'i 'gog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like space and nonanalytical cessation.

original: yang gzhan dag ni 'gog pa mtha' dag gi dbang du byas nas 'gog pa ni 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni 'gog pa mtha' dag gi dbang du byas nas 'gog pa ni 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Others explain that all cessations are not similar,

original: 'gog pa dang 'dra ba chos gzhan pa dang dge ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang 'dra ba chos gzhan pa dang dge ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no other phenomenon that is similar to cessation and no other virtue.

original: skye la gtan du gegs byed pa //
analyzed: skye la gtan du gegs byed pa //
translated: It is an obstruction to the generation of that which is to arise.

original: zhes pa la 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams skye ba la gegs byed pa ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa rnams kho na'i 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams skye ba la gegs byed pa ma yin pas ma 'ongs pa rnams kho na'i 'thob pa'o //
translated: Since past and present states are not obstructions to the generation of future states, they do not obtain future states.

original: 'gog pa yang rnam pa lnga bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa yang rnam pa lnga bsam par bya ste /
translated: Cessation should be contemplated as fivefold:

original: mi rtag pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba dang so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i dbye ba las so //
translated: It is classified as impermanence, meditative attainment, birth, analytical and non-analytical cessation.

original: de la skye ba smos pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir du'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba smos pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir du'o //
translated: The mention of birth is for the purpose of excluding the cessation of impermanence.

original: de ni da ltar byung ba rnams gnas pa la gegs su gyur pa yin gyi skye ba la ni ma yin @32a * //
analyzed: de ni da ltar byung ba rnams gnas pa la gegs su gyur pa yin gyi skye ba la ni ma yin @32a * //
translated: It is an obstruction to the endurance of present entities, but not to their birth.

original: no ; / gtan du zhes smos pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba'i 'gog pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: no ; / gtan du zhes smos pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba'i 'gog pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the cessation of meditative attainment and birth,

original: de gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba la dus cung zad cig gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba la dus cung zad cig gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two are obstructions for a short time to the birth of future minds and mental factors.

original: gzhan smos pa ni de ma thag tu smos pa bral ba'i mtshan nyid so sor brtags pas 'gog pa las rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan smos pa ni de ma thag tu smos pa bral ba'i mtshan nyid so sor brtags pas 'gog pa las rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúother‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the cessation of separation, which is the characteristic of the immediately preceding condition.

original: so sor brtags pa ni rig pa dang dpyad pas bsgrubs pa'i shes rab ste de ni des thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ni rig pa dang dpyad pas bsgrubs pa'i shes rab ste de ni des thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Discernment is wisdom established by means of knowledge and investigation. It is not obtained by that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de med par rkyen ma tshang bas thob ste de ltar gzhan du brjod do //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de med par rkyen ma tshang bas thob ste de ltar gzhan du brjod do //
translated: If that is so, then what is obtained? It is obtained by the non-existence of conditions, due to the incompleteness of conditions.

original: gang zhig rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag dang dmigs pa dang bdag po ste rkyen bzhi po dag las bzhi'am gsum gnyis kyang rung ji snyed cig gis skyed pa de skye ba la de dag ma tshang bas gtan du gegs su gyur bas so sor brtags pa
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag dang dmigs pa dang bdag po ste rkyen bzhi po dag las bzhi'am gsum gnyis kyang rung ji snyed cig gis skyed pa de skye ba la de dag ma tshang bas gtan du gegs su gyur bas so sor brtags pa
translated: That which is produced by any of the four conditions, such as cause, similar immediately antecedent condition, object, and dominant condition, or by three, two, or even one, is produced by those.

original: ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas shig 'thob po //üîΩdper na mig dang yid gzugs gcig la yengs pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas shig 'thob po // dper na mig dang yid gzugs gcig la yengs pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: When those are incomplete, it is permanently obstructed. Non-discernment is obtained as a substance.üîΩFor example, when the eye and mind are distracted by one form, it is said.

original: gzugs gcig la yengs pa'i mig dang yid gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzugs gcig la yengs pa'i mig dang yid gang yin pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The eye and mind that are distracted by one form should be connected to the sentence.

original: gang zhig gzugs las gzhan rnams zhes bya ba yul du byas pa las gzhan pa sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg rnams kyang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs las gzhan rnams zhes bya ba yul du byas pa las gzhan pa sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg rnams kyang zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are other than form‚Äù refers to sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects, which are different from the object that is being perceived.

original: thams cad nyid ni de rnams thams cad nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad nyid ni de rnams thams cad nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them are capable of taking all of them as their objects.

original: 'das par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni zhig 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'das par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni zhig 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey would become‚Äù means that they would cease to exist.

original: da ltar ba'i dus na rgyu dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen yod kyang de ma thag rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dus na rgyu dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen yod kyang de ma thag rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though the conditions of cause, object, and predominance exist in the present, the condition of the immediately preceding mind does not exist.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni yang skye bar mi nus te so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni yang skye bar mi nus te so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the five collections of consciousness that have those objects are incapable of arising again, because they have attained the cessation that is due to deliberation.

original: yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that they will not arise again?

original: de'i phyir de dag 'das pa'i yul la de dmigs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag 'das pa'i yul la de dmigs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúBecause they lack the power to take those past objects as their objects.‚Äù This is what is being taught:

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa rnams la mi skye ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'das pa rnams la mi skye ste /
translated: The eye consciousness and so on do not arise in regard to past form and so on because they are present objects.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: They do not arise because the objective condition is incomplete.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang nges par rkyen bzhi las @32b skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang nges par rkyen bzhi las @32b skye'o zhes zer ro //

original: yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yid dang chos kyi skye mched kyi phyogs 'ga' zhig kyang brjod par bya ste /

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni dpe nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni dpe nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousnesses of the eye and so on are mentioned as examples.

original: 'dir gzhan dag gis rgol ba ni mig dang yid gzugs gcig la yengs pa na gzhan rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ci las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag gis rgol ba ni mig dang yid gzugs gcig la yengs pa na gzhan rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ci las /

original: gcig nyid dus gcig tu rgyud dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen du gyur bas mig la sogs pa rnams 'dod kyi cig shos ma yin /

original: skyes bu'i byed pa don med par thal bas ma 'ongs pa'i dus ba rgyu ba yo ge n'a pa brga bra sangga da pa brga med par thal bar 'gyur bas 'di yang 'dod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa don med par thal bas ma 'ongs pa'i dus ba rgyu ba yo ge n'a pa brga bra sangga da pa brga med par thal bar 'gyur bas 'di yang 'dod pa ma yin pa nyid do //

analyzed: rkyen med par 'dus byas kyi chos 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa rnams nyid ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa thob la /
translated: Therefore, those that are associated with contamination are attained through analytical cessation.

original: 'dus byas mi skye ba'i chos can rnams ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba skye ba'i chos can rnams so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na'i yin gyi so sor ba rtags pa ma yin pas 'gog ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas mi skye ba'i chos can rnams ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o // zag pa dang bcas pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba skye ba'i chos can rnams so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na'i yin gyi so sor ba rtags pa ma yin pas 'gog ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Those that are conditioned and have the property of non-arising are non-analytical cessations.üîΩThose that are associated with contamination and have the property of arising in the past and present are only analytical cessations.

original: de ni mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kho na'i yin no //
translated: They are not non-analytical cessations, because those are only for those that have the property of non-arising.

original: zag pa bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are associated with contamination‚Äù is stated in order to exclude those that are uncontaminated.

original: nyes pa med pa'i phyir zag med rnams ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa'i phyir zag med rnams ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Uncontaminated states are analytical cessations because they are free of faults.

original: de la rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis da ltar byung ba'i thob pa 'gog pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa thob bo //
analyzed: de la rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis da ltar byung ba'i thob pa 'gog pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa thob bo //
translated: One obtains analytical cessations of past and future afflicted phenomena that are included in one‚Äôs mindstream because the power of wisdom stops the obtainment of those that occur in the present.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs ba'i nyon mongs pa dus gsum pa rnams thams cad kyang so sor brtags pas de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa thob po //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs ba'i nyon mongs pa dus gsum pa rnams thams cad kyang so sor brtags pas de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa gcod pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa thob po //
translated: One obtains analytical cessations of all afflicted states of others‚Äô mindstreams that exist in the three times because the power of wisdom stops the obtainment of those that occur in the present.

original: yang na rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i thob pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / thob pa ni da ltar rang gi thob pa dang bral ba'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa thob bo //
analyzed: yang na rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i thob pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / thob pa ni da ltar rang gi thob pa dang bral ba'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa thob bo //
translated: Or, one obtains analytical cessations of past and future afflicted states that are included in one‚Äôs mindstream because one is free of the obtainment of those that occur in the present and one obtains analytical cessations of present afflicted states because one is free of the obtainment of those that occur in the present.

original: yang na rang gi rgyud la yang dus gsum pa'i spangs pa @33b thob bo //üîΩsam yo ga ni ro dhyo hi bi sam yo ga a'a k'a sh'a ta so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ldan pa yang kun tu sbyor ba 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyi thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na rang gi rgyud la yang dus gsum pa'i spangs pa @33b thob bo // sam yo ga ni ro dhyo hi bi sam yo ga a'a k'a sh'a ta so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ldan pa yang kun tu sbyor ba 'khor dang bcas pa rnams kyi thob pa rnams so //
translated: Or else, one obtains the cessation of the past and future defilements of one's own stream.üîΩThe possession of analytical cessation is the possession of the fetters and their concomitants.

original: kun tu sbyor ba'i 'khor gyi thob pa de rnams kyang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa nyid thob pa /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba'i 'khor gyi thob pa de rnams kyang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa nyid thob pa /
translated: The possession of the fetters and their concomitants is the possession of analytical cessation.

original: zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas mi skye ba'i chos can rnams ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pa kho na ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i 'dus byas mi skye ba'i chos can rnams ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob pa kho na ste /
translated: Unconditioned uncontaminated factors that are not subject to arising are obtained only through non-analytical cessation.

original: de dag zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med kyi rkyen ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob bo //
analyzed: de dag zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med kyi rkyen ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa thob bo //
translated: Because they are uncontaminated, they are not subject to analytical cessation. They are obtained through non-analytical cessation because their conditions are incomplete.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can smos pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i skye ba'i chos rnam par gcad pa'i phyir du'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can smos pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i skye ba'i chos rnam par gcad pa'i phyir du'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat are not subject to arising‚Äù is mentioned in order to exclude those that are subject to arising, which are past and present.

original: zag pa med pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa bsal ba'i phyir du'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa bsal ba'i phyir du'o //
translated: The term uncontaminated is mentioned to exclude contaminated states.

original: 'dus byas smos pa ni 'dus ma byas bsal ba'i phyir te de yang mi skye ba'i chos can dang zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas smos pa ni 'dus ma byas bsal ba'i phyir te de yang mi skye ba'i chos can dang zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: The term conditioned is mentioned to exclude unconditioned states, which are also unarisen and uncontaminated.üîΩFor example, when the path of one who is a follower through faith is manifest, the path of one who is a follower through doctrine is not manifest because conditions are incomplete.

original: dper na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mngon du gyur pa na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam rkyen ma tshang bas so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog par thob pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshe sdug bsngal la chos shes
analyzed: dper na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mngon du gyur pa na chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam rkyen ma tshang bas so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog par thob pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshe sdug bsngal la chos shes
translated: When one obtains the cessation not attained by analysis, one obtains the four future states of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.üîΩSimilarly, when perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering is manifest, one obtains the four future states of perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa rnams bzhi char dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshe sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rnams te de ltar bden pa so so la brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa rnams bzhi char dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshe sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa rnams te de ltar bden pa so so la brjod par bya zhing /
translated: This should be applied to each truth.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to other states.

original: gnyi ga zag pa dang bcas pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams te 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyi ga zag pa dang bcas pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams te 'di dag zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin la /
translated: Both are contaminated and nonarisen phenomena.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: They are cessation through analysis because they are contaminated and they are cessation not through analysis because they are nonarisen phenomena.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni zag pa med pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang skye ba'i chos can rnams te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni zag pa med pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang skye ba'i chos can rnams te /
translated: Neither is uncontaminated past and present states and those that arise.

original: de rnams ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: de rnams ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi 'thob po //
translated: They are not obtained as cessation through analysis because they are uncontaminated.

original: skyes pa dang skye ba'i chos can nyid kyi phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa dang skye ba'i chos can nyid kyi phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: They are cessation not through analysis because they are arisen and possess arising.üîΩJust as contaminated states are objects to be known, so too are conditioned states.

original: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa rnams shes par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dus byas rnams kyang yin pas 'dus byas de dag gang zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa rnams shes par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dus byas rnams kyang yin pas 'dus byas de dag gang zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: Therefore the root text asks, What are conditioned states?

original: @34a * // lam gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bzung nas dris so //
analyzed: @34a * // lam gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir 'dus byas zhes bzung nas dris so //
translated: The question is asked, taking the conditioned as the subject, in order to include all conditioned things except for the truth of the path.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
translated: Those conditioned things are

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga // zhes gsungs te /
translated: the five aggregates, such as form.

original: de la nad dang rga shi la sogs pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i khyad par rnams kyis gnod pas na phung po'o //
analyzed: de la nad dang rga shi la sogs pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i khyad par rnams kyis gnod pas na phung po'o //
translated: Therein, the aggregates are so called because they are harmed by the various kinds of suffering, such as disease, old age, and death.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phung po lnga rnam par gcad pa'i phyir du gzugs la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i phung po lnga rnam par gcad pa'i phyir du gzugs la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The words form, etc., are used in order to distinguish the five aggregates that are associated with morality, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dgag pa'i phyir phung po zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dgag pa'i phyir phung po zhes smos so //
translated: The word aggregate is used in order to deny that form, etc., are objects.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa byas pa'i phyir na byas na zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam byed pa'i dus byas zhes pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa byas pa'i phyir na byas na zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam byed pa'i dus byas zhes pa don med do zhe na /
translated: If form, etc., are called conditioned because they are produced, then it is meaningless to say that they are produced because they are conditioned.

original: don med pa ma yin te de ni rkyen gcig gis skyed pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: don med pa ma yin te de ni rkyen gcig gis skyed pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir de ltar bshad do //
translated: It is not meaningless, because it is taught that there is nothing that is produced by a single condition.

original: byas pa zhes brjod na ni gzugs la sogs ba rkyen gcig gis skyed pa nyid ma bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa zhes brjod na ni gzugs la sogs ba rkyen gcig gis skyed pa nyid ma bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were said that they are produced, then the production of form, etc. by a single condition would not be refuted.

original: 'dus byas kyi sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pas na 'dus byas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pas na 'dus byas zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to show the meaning of the term conditioned, it is said that they are conditioned because they are produced by the convergence and combination of conditions.

original: 'dus shing zhes bya ba ni tshogs shing zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu bskyed pa la phan tshun rjes su mthun par gyur nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dus shing zhes bya ba ni tshogs shing zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu bskyed pa la phan tshun rjes su mthun par gyur nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The convergence of conditions is their combination, which means that they are mutually compatible in the production of an effect.

original: 'dir snga ma ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la phyi ma ni bshad pa'i tshig yin te snga ma kho na'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir snga ma ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la phyi ma ni bshad pa'i tshig yin te snga ma kho na'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the former is the word of the teaching and the latter is the word of explanation, because it is a synonym of the former alone.

original: 'dus shing zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus tha dad pa rnams 'bras bu rjes su mthun pa'i phyir 'dus par ston te /
analyzed: 'dus shing zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus tha dad pa rnams 'bras bu rjes su mthun pa'i phyir 'dus par ston te /
translated: By the word convergence, it is shown that they are combined because of the compatibility of their effects, even though they are different in time.

original: dper na yid rnam par shes pa la 'das pa'i yid dang ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yid rnam par shes pa la 'das pa'i yid dang ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the past mind and future things are like the mental consciousness.

original: phrad nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus tha mi dad pa rnams te /
analyzed: phrad nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus tha mi dad pa rnams te /
translated: The word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù indicates that the conditions are not different in time.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig dang gzugs dag dang / myu gu la sa dang chu dang sa bon rnams bzhin no zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig dang gzugs dag dang / myu gu la sa dang chu dang sa bon rnams bzhin no zhes kha cig go //
translated: For example, the eye and visible form are conditions of the visual consciousness, and the earth, water, and seed are conditions of the sprout.

original: yang gzhan dag na re 'dus shing zhes bya ba ni bar chad med par skye bar byed pa sa dang chu dang sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re 'dus shing zhes bya ba ni bar chad med par skye bar byed pa sa dang chu dang sa bon bzhin no //
translated: Others say that the word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù indicates that the conditions produce their effect without interval, like the earth, water, and seed are conditions of the sprout.

original: phrad nas zhes bya ba mig dang gzugs dus gcig tu gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phrad nas zhes bya ba mig dang gzugs dus gcig tu gyur pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù indicates that the eye and visible form are simultaneous conditions.

original: gzhan dag na re snga mas ni phan tshun phrad pa ston la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re snga mas ni phan tshun phrad pa ston la /
translated: Others say that the first word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù indicates mutual contact,

original: phyi mas ni rkyen thams cad kyi bya ba ston to //
analyzed: phyi mas ni rkyen thams cad kyi bya ba ston to //
translated: and the second word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù indicates the activity of all the conditions.

original: bshad pa snga mar res 'ga' gcig gis kyang byas so snyam du dogs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phrad @34b nas zhes bya ba smos so zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: bshad pa snga mar res 'ga' gcig gis kyang byas so snyam du dogs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir phrad @34b nas zhes bya ba smos so zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Still others say that the first word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù is stated to eliminate the doubt that a single condition might produce the effect,üîΩand the second word ‚Äúmeeting‚Äù is stated to eliminate the doubt that the conditions might produce the effect without meeting.

original: bshad pa 'di dag la dang po gnyis ni phrad nas zhes bya ba 'di'i don ma yin te bya ba thams cad la rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dag la dang po gnyis ni phrad nas zhes bya ba 'di'i don ma yin te bya ba thams cad la rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first two explanations are not the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúafter coming together,‚Äù because there is no specific conformity to all actions.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni rkyen gcig gis skyed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes pa dang 'brel med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni rkyen gcig gis skyed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes pa dang 'brel med pa nyid do //
translated: The latter two explanations are not related to the statement ‚ÄúNothing is produced by a single condition.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: The four produce minds and mental factors.

original: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
analyzed: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
translated: The three produce the two meditative attainments.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skyes //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skyes //
translated: The others arise from both.

original: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
translated: They are not produced by God and so on because of sequence and so on.

original: zhes so // byung ba'i gyur pa'i dus la rkyen ktv'a bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes so // byung ba'i gyur pa'i dus la rkyen ktv'a bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the time of occurrence is established by the present tense,

original: ma byas pa nyid dang byed par 'gyur ba skye ba'i chos can rnams 'dus byas nyid do //
analyzed: ma byas pa nyid dang byed par 'gyur ba skye ba'i chos can rnams 'dus byas nyid do //
translated: the future tense is established by the future tense and the present tense is established by the present tense.üîΩThe future tense is established by the present tense because the future tense is established by the present tense.

original: ci ltar brjod ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar brjod ce na de'i phyir /
translated: How is this expressed?

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dag la yang mi 'gal te 'o ma bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa dag la yang mi 'gal te 'o ma bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said: It is not contradictory for future states to be conditioned states because they are similar to that, like milk.

original: dper na de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir 'jo bar 'gyur ba dang 'jo bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa dag la yang 'o ma zhes brjod pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can dang skye ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag la yang 'dus byasüîΩzhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir 'jo bar 'gyur ba dang 'jo bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa dag la yang 'o ma zhes brjod pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can dang skye ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag la yang 'dus byas zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: For example, just as milk is said to exist in both that which is being milked and that which is not being milked because it is similar to that which is being milked, in the same way, the term conditioned

original: skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pas 'dus ma byas rnam par gcad pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid 'dra ba'i phyir dang de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pas 'dus ma byas rnam par gcad pa'i sgo nas rang gi mtshan nyid 'dra ba'i phyir dang de dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: applies to both that which is to arise in the future and that which is not to arise in the future because they are similar in having their own characteristics that are distinguished from unconditioned states by possessing characteristics such as arising.üîΩThey are similar to that which is being milked.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dus la sogs pa rnams kyang bstan la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dus la sogs pa rnams kyang bstan la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn taught time and so on,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan dag kyang med na de ci /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan dag kyang med na de ci /
translated: but if there are no other phenomena apart from conditioned and unconditioned states,

original: dus la sogs pa rnams 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas yin zhe na /
analyzed: dus la sogs pa rnams 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas yin zhe na /
translated: then are time and so on conditioned or unconditioned?üîΩTherefore he said:üîΩTime, the basis of discourse,

original: de'i phyir de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas gzhi dang bcas //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas gzhi dang bcas //
translated: is said to be both conditioned and unconditioned.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: yang na 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi ming rab las grags pa 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi ming rab las grags pa 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, it explains the well-known names of conditioned phenomena.

original: kun tu rmongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir de dag nyid dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir de dag nyid dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to eliminate confusion, he says: ‚ÄúThose very things are called time, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams so //

analyzed: de bzhin du yang yod pa nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: gzhan dag ni de ltar bzhi po de gtam du bya ba ma yin no zhes so // gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i nges par 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba la 'byung bar byed pas ni 'byung ba ste 'gro zhes bya ba ni 'chag go //

original: gong ma chags par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gong ma chags par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: de yang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te /

original: der song ba la slar 'ongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der song ba la slar 'ongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dir mu bzhi dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir mu bzhi dang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin te /

original: shes bya'i chos rnams gang zhe na /

original: gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /

translated: Just as one who has higher perception and full knowledge of a thing, in dependence on that thing, realizes that the monk who is completely pacified has cut off the basis, and that the end of cyclic existence is the nonexistence of further existence, so one realizes that the cause is cut off.üîΩOne realizes that the basis is the object of the term basis because it is said:

original: zhing gi gzhi dang khyim gyi gzhi dang tshong khang gi gzhi dang nor gyi gzhi dang yongs su gzung ba spangs te zhes bya bas ni yongs su 'dzin pa zhes rtogs te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhi'i sgra don du ma can yin pa dang / 'dir rang bzhin gyi don zhes ji ltar rtogs she na /

original: de ni cig shos la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni cig shos la yang mtshungs so //

original: yang gzhi med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang gzhi med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams so zhes bshad pa la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams so zhes bshad pa la /

original: de rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: gzhi'i sgra ni rang bzhin brjod pa'o zhes shes par bya'o //

translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe origin of suffering‚Äù is that suffering arises from it, because it is the homogeneous cause of an entity.

original: lam la yang kun 'byung nyid thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: lam la yang kun 'byung nyid thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But it does not follow that the path is the origin of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la skyo bar gyur ba rnams 'di'i kun 'byung ba gang yin zhes de'i rgyu yongs su rtogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kho na kun 'byung yin gyi lam gyi rgyu ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar 'ga' yang lam la skyo ba de'i rgyu yongs su rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la skyo bar gyur ba rnams 'di'i kun 'byung ba gang yin zhes de'i rgyu yongs su rtogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kho na kun 'byung yin gyi lam gyi rgyu ni ma yin no // 'di ltar 'ga' yang lam la skyo ba de'i rgyu yongs su rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: Those who are disgusted with suffering want to know its cause, and so the origin is only the cause of suffering, not the cause of the path.üîΩFor no one is disgusted with the path, and so there is no need to know its cause.

original: lam gyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu de'i rgyu yongs su brtag pa'i phyir lam thams cad dngos po rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de'i rgyu la kun 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal ba med do //
analyzed: lam gyis ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu de'i rgyu yongs su brtag pa'i phyir lam thams cad dngos po rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de'i rgyu la kun 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal ba med do //
translated: The path is not the cause of nirvana, and so it is not the origin of suffering.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig rten zhes pa la 'gog pa'i phyir gnyen po nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig rten zhes pa la 'gog pa'i phyir gnyen po nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúworld‚Äù (loka) is derived from the root ‚àöluj, ‚Äúto be destroyed,‚Äù and so it is the antidote to the idea of permanence.

original: 'jig pa lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa lam la thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: But it does not follow that the path is impermanent.

original: gzhan dag na re mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig go zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the world is destroyed by impermanence.

original: de ltar na lam la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lam la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But then it would follow, absurdly, that the path is also impermanent.

original: gang du 'jig rten gyi sgra 'di gting tshugs pa de nyid du 'di'i nges pa'i tshig byang bas lam la thal ba med do //
analyzed: gang du 'jig rten gyi sgra 'di gting tshugs pa de nyid du 'di'i nges pa'i tshig byang bas lam la thal ba med do //
translated: Wherever this worldly sound is deeply rooted, there is no path to liberation, since its etymology is mastered.

original: 'di la lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga rnams so //
analyzed: 'di la lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga rnams so //
translated: Here, views are the five types beginning with the afflicted view of the self.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gnas bas na zhes pa la /
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gnas bas na zhes pa la /
translated: They are called abodes because they are abodes that are expanded.

original: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba dang zag pa dang nye bar len pa dang 'thab pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir dang lta ba rnams kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po la nyon mongs pa thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba dang zag pa dang nye bar len pa dang 'thab pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir dang lta ba rnams kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since it is explained that all afflictions are expanded in relation to contaminated things, and since views are like attachment and so on,

original: zhes sngar nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na 'di ni @40a * //
analyzed: zhes sngar nyid du bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na 'di ni @40a * //
translated: aren't they taught to be abodes?

original: bden mod kyi de lta na yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi tshe rnam grangs med par ni lta ba rnams kyi gnas g-yo ba med pa yin te brtan par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden mod kyi de lta na yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi tshe rnam grangs med par ni lta ba rnams kyi gnas g-yo ba med pa yin te brtan par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is true, but still, in all contaminated things, views are unshakable abodes, since they are grasped as stable, without exception.

original: de'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni de kho na'i gnas yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po ni de kho na'i gnas yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the realm of thatness is the domain of the contaminated entity.

original: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ma rig pa dang the tshom rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ma rig pa dang the tshom rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the domain of attachment, etc., nor of ignorance and doubt.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni thams cad ma yin la thams cad kyi tshe yang ma yin no //üîΩma rig ni thams cad kyi tshe yin gyi rnam grangs med par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni thams cad ma yin la thams cad kyi tshe yang ma yin no // ma rig ni thams cad kyi tshe yin gyi rnam grangs med par ni ma yin te /
translated: Attachment, etc., are not universal contaminants because they are contaminants of specific characteristics, and they do not occur at all times.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance occurs at all times, but it is not universal, because all the dharmas associated with attachment, etc., are considered to be attachment, etc.

original: the tshom la ni thams cad yod mod kyi brtan par 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom la ni thams cad yod mod kyi brtan par 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Doubt exists at all times, but it is not universal, because it does not grasp its object tenaciously.

original: de'i phyir de ni de dag gi gnas su mi brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de dag gi gnas su mi brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not described as the domain of those contaminants.

original: 'byung bas na srid pa ste zhes pa ni gang zhig kun 'byung ba las byung ba de la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'byung bas na srid pa ste zhes pa ni gang zhig kun 'byung ba las byung ba de la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Existence is that from which there is an origination; that is, one desires the origination of that.

original: de lta na lam la yang thal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta na lam la yang thal ba med do //
translated: If that were so, then the consequence would be that the path would also be contaminated.

original: yang na srid pa'i sgra 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mtshams bcad pas de dag nyid la nges par brjod de /
analyzed: yang na srid pa'i sgra 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la mtshams bcad pas de dag nyid la nges par brjod de /
translated: Or else, the term existence is restricted to the five appropriated aggregates, because it is said in a s≈´tra:

original: mdo las srid pa gang zhe na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las srid pa gang zhe na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is existence? It is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi 'jug pa 'byung bas na srid pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi 'jug pa 'byung bas na srid pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Or else, it is called existence because it is the occurrence of the process of contaminated phenomena.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di las 'byung ba dang 'di la 'byung bas na sred pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di las 'byung ba dang 'di la 'byung bas na sred pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is craving because it arises from this and it arises in this.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni zang zing dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs nye bar bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni zang zing dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs nye bar bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The term also indicates that there are other synonyms of contaminated states.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, the term contaminated states is explained in detail.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam grangs don ji lta bar bshad pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba don dang 'dra ba
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam grangs don ji lta bar bshad pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i don gyi rjes su 'gro ba don dang 'dra ba
translated: The terms ‚Äúappropriated aggregates‚Äù and ‚Äúexistence‚Äù are synonyms for the contaminated. They are synonyms for the contaminated because they correspond to the meaning of the appropriated aggregates, etc., as explained above.

original: don dang mthun pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: don dang mthun pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: They are synonyms for the contaminated because they correspond to the meaning of the contaminated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga zhes smras pa de la zhes bya ba la smras pa'i tshig ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po rnams kyi dbang du byas pa la rab tu bstan par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga zhes smras pa de la zhes bya ba la smras pa'i tshig ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po rnams kyi dbang du byas pa la rab tu bstan par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe five aggregates beginning with form‚Äù is a statement that is to be fully understood in terms of the aggregates beginning with form.

original: gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
translated: Form is the five sense faculties,

original: lnga dang rnam rig byed min @40b nyid ;
analyzed: lnga dang rnam rig byed min @40b nyid ;
translated: five sense objects, and non-informative form.

original: / ces bya ba la gzugs smos pas ni skabs kyi phung po'i gzugs gzung bar rig par bya'i skye mched kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / ces bya ba la gzugs smos pas ni skabs kyi phung po'i gzugs gzung bar rig par bya'i skye mched kyi gzugs ni ma yin no //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúform‚Äù in the statement ‚ÄúThe five aggregates beginning with form‚Äù should be understood as referring to the form aggregate in this context, not to the form sense-sphere.

original: gnyi gar grangs bstan pa ni dbang po rnams dang yul rnams mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi gar grangs bstan pa ni dbang po rnams dang yul rnams mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The number of both is taught because there are many faculties and objects.

original: thams cad gzugs kyi bdag nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang yul can dang yul gyi sgo nas gzugs kyi phung po bstan pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag dang gzugs la sogs pa dag la mngon par 'dod do zhes shes par bya'o //üîΩrnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir don lnga'i khong gsum 'dus pas dbang po lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad gzugs kyi bdag nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang yul can dang yul gyi sgo nas gzugs kyi phung po bstan pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag dang gzugs la sogs pa dag la mngon par 'dod do zhes shes par bya'o // rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir don lnga'i khong gsum 'dus pas dbang po lnga'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu bstan to //
translated: It should be understood that the eye and so on and form and so on are asserted to be the form aggregate from the perspective of subject and object because they are accepted as the nature of form.üîΩNonindicative form is taught separately because it is included in the phenomena base and it is not the object of the five sense faculties since it is not a composite of the five objects.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kho na'i zhes de las gzhan pa chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs mdo sde pa la sogs pas kun btags pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kho na'i zhes de las gzhan pa chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs mdo sde pa la sogs pas kun btags pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word only is for the purpose of exclusion because the Vaibhasikas assert that nonindicative form is form that is not the object of the five sense faculties.

original: dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúincluding. ‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa dag gang dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis rtogs pas na don te khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag gang dag gi rnam par shes pa dag gis rtogs pas na don te khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The objects are those things that are perceived by the consciousnesses of the eye, etc. The meaning is that they are comprehended.

original: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po ni skye mched bcu dang gcig gi phyogs gcig yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi phung po ni skye mched bcu dang gcig gi phyogs gcig yin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here it is shown that the form aggregate is ten bases and one part of a base.

original: ci ste 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhig ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhig ce na / de'i phyir / de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat are their characteristics? ‚ÄùüîΩTherefore it is said:

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The eye, etc. are the pure form that is the basis of the consciousnesses of those.

original: de zhes pa'i sgra ni bar du mchod pa'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa khas blangs te gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa'i sgra ni bar du mchod pa'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa khas blangs te gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù is used because the interval is omitted. It is accepted in the world and should be applied to the objects of form, etc.

original: 'jig rten na ni gzugs kyi blo sgra'i blo zhes yul gyi sgo nas rnam par shes pa ston gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni gzugs kyi blo sgra'i blo zhes yul gyi sgo nas rnam par shes pa ston gyi /
translated: In the world, consciousness is indicated by way of its object, as in the expressions ‚Äúconsciousness of form‚Äù and ‚Äúconsciousness of sound. ‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas ma yin no //
translated: It is not indicated by way of the consciousness itself.

original: rnam par shes pa de dag gi rten ni de dag rnams kyi rnam shes te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dag gi rten ni de dag rnams kyi rnam shes te /
translated: The support of those consciousnesses is the consciousness of those.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
translated: Because they are transformed by that,

original: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin // zhes bshad ba lta bu'o //
translated: the support is the eye, etc.

original: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: The five that have the nature of form are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa ni lung ngam rigs pa las 'gyur la /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don rtogs pa ni lung ngam rigs pa las 'gyur la /
translated: The understanding of a meaning that is beyond the senses is from scripture or reasoning.

original: yid ches pa ma yin pa rnams kyi tshig tsam la ni gus par bya ba yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: yid ches pa ma yin pa rnams kyi tshig tsam la ni gus par bya ba yang ma yin pas /
translated: But one should not respect the mere words of those who are not credible.

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams zhes bya ba 'di la lung @41a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams zhes bya ba 'di la lung @41a * //
translated: The eye, etc., are clear form.

original: ston pa ni /
analyzed: ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching is:üîΩAs the Bhagavat said, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la dang ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la dang ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of clear is this.

original: dper na me long dang ba'am chu'i snod du gzugs la brten nas de'i snang ba gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin nas gzugs kyi bdag nyid dang ba lnga po la yang gzugs la sogs pa dag la brten de'i snang ba'i rnam rig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na me long dang ba'am chu'i snod du gzugs la brten nas de'i snang ba gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de bzhin nas gzugs kyi bdag nyid dang ba lnga po la yang gzugs la sogs pa dag la brten de'i snang ba'i rnam rig 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, the consciousness that is the appearance of form arises in dependence on the five clear elements that have the nature of form.

original: 'dir gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / rten gyi dngos por khyad par med pa'i phyir na mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun dang yid las rnam par gcad par bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / rten gyi dngos por khyad par med pa'i phyir na mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun dang yid las rnam par gcad par bya dgos te /
translated: Here, the eyes, etc. must be distinguished from each other and from the mental faculty, because they are not distinguished by having the nature of clear form, and because they are not distinguished by being the basis of clear form.

original: de'i phyir de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba gnyi ga brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba gnyi ga brjod do //
translated: Therefore, both are mentioned: the basis of consciousness of those and clear form.

original: de la de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyis ni mig la sogs ba rnams phan tshun las rnam par gcod de /
analyzed: de la de dag rnams kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid kyis ni mig la sogs ba rnams phan tshun las rnam par gcod de /
translated: Among them, the eyes, etc. are distinguished from each other by being the basis of consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig kho na yin gyi rna ba la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten mig kho na yin gyi rna ba la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: The eye is the basis of the visual consciousness alone, not of the auditory consciousness, etc.

original: de bzhin du ji srid reg bya'i rnam par shes pa'i rten ni lus kho na yin gyi mig la sogs pa rnams ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji srid reg bya'i rnam par shes pa'i rten ni lus kho na yin gyi mig la sogs pa rnams ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: Similarly, the body is the basis of the tactile consciousness alone, not of the visual consciousness, etc.

original: gal te de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na /
translated: If that is so,

original: lnga rnams kyi //
analyzed: lnga rnams kyi //
translated: then the five sense faculties

original: de dang lhan cig skyes pa'ang yin //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig skyes pa'ang yin //
translated: are also coexistent with the consciousnesses.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yod kyang mig la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yod kyang mig la sogs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the five sense faculties are the basis of the five consciousnesses, it follows that the eye, etc., exist even though they are not form.

original: de yang de'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang de'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are the basis of the consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúThey are called clear form.‚Äù

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can gang dag yin pa de dag ni mig la sogs pa rnams kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can gang dag yin pa de dag ni mig la sogs pa rnams kho na yin gyi /
translated: The eye, etc., are the basis of the consciousnesses that are clear form by nature.

original: yid ma yin no zhes shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid ma yin no zhes shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is understood that the mental faculty is not.

original: 'o na gzugs smos kyi don ma yin pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gzugs smos kyi don ma yin pa ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why does the Abhidharmako≈õa mention form?

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang ba mig la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba 'di sa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang ba mig la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba 'di sa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye, etc., which are the clear forms that are the supports of those consciousnesses, are established.

original: gzugs can nam gzugs can ma yin pa de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang ba las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can nam gzugs can ma yin pa de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten dang ba las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no clear form that is the support of those consciousnesses, whether they are material or not.

translated: And it says this:

original: mdo las gang gsungs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten khyad par gyi tshig ma gsungs so //üîΩgzugs smos pa gnod pa med pa can no zhes pa de yang mi rigs te 'byung ba rgyur byas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The s≈´tra does not state that the eye, etc. are the special bases of the eye consciousness, etc.üîΩThe statement that the mention of form is not contradictory is also illogical because it is said that the elements are its cause.

analyzed: gzugs smos pa don med pa can te gzugs can ma yin pa'i dang ba 'byung ba rgyur byas pa med do //

analyzed: de'i phyir mdo yang 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i dang ba zhes brjod par bya'i gzugs dang ba zhes ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dir 'bru mang po pa'i bsdu ba ldog pa'i phyir du gzugs smos pa rigs pa ma yin no //

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: yang na gang 'jig rten na krishna s'a ra dang autpa la'i 'dab ma'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la mig ces brjod de /
analyzed: yang na gang 'jig rten na krishna s'a ra dang autpa la'i 'dab ma'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la mig ces brjod de /
translated: Or, in the world, that which is the nature of the petals of a blue lotus and a black antelope is called ‚Äúeye.‚Äù

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa brten no zhes bzlog ste brjod pa'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi mig ma yin pa la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa brten no zhes bzlog ste brjod pa'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi mig ma yin pa la yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba zhes bya ste /

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //

original: gzhan dag @42a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag @42a * //
translated: Others say:

analyzed: na re gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of basis of consciousness of form and so on:

original: mig la sogs pa dang yong ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang yong ngo //
translated: the eye and so on and the form and so on.

original: dang ba ni rnam pa gsum ste dang pa'i dang ba dang / skye mched kyi gzugs dang ba dang / dbang po'i gzugs dang ba rnams so //
analyzed: dang ba ni rnam pa gsum ste dang pa'i dang ba dang / skye mched kyi gzugs dang ba dang / dbang po'i gzugs dang ba rnams so //

original: de la de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten smos pa ni skye mched kyi gzugs dang ba las khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: de la de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten smos pa ni skye mched kyi gzugs dang ba las khyad par du byed do //
translated: Among them, the mention of the basis of consciousness distinguishes it from the clarity of the sense-sphere form.

original: gzugs smos pas ni dang ba'i bdag nyid las khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: gzugs smos pas ni dang ba'i bdag nyid las khyad par du byed do //

original: dang ba smos pas ni yid las khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: dang ba smos pas ni yid las khyad par du byed do //

analyzed: gal te dad pa rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten smos pa nyid kyis bsal ba ma yin nam zhe na /

original: gzugs smos pa don med pa can dang ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa notpi so rnam par shes par 'dod pa de'i phyir yid bzhin du de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur ba rnam par shes pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: gzugs smos pa don med pa can dang ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur pa notpi so rnam par shes par 'dod pa de'i phyir yid bzhin du de ma thag pa'i rkyen du gyur ba rnam par shes pa'i rten yin no //
translated: The mention of form is meaningless. Clarity is considered the immediately preceding condition of consciousness. Therefore, like the mental faculty, it is the basis of consciousness as the immediately preceding condition.

original: gcig la yang tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur mngon par 'dra la ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rten dang pa'o zhes rung ba 'di ni de lta ma yin te bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la yang tshogs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur mngon par 'dra la ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rten dang pa'o zhes rung ba 'di ni de lta ma yin te bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first support of consciousness is suitable to be called the support of consciousness, because it is similar to the other supports in being the support of consciousness and in being the support of the collection of aggregates. But this is not the case with the other supports, because that would contradict the treatise.

original: bstan bcos su ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gsungs so ;
analyzed: bstan bcos su ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gsungs so ;
translated: The treatise declares the eye to be the support of eye consciousness and so on.

original: / de lta na sems las byung ba rten yin pa'i phyir rten rnams kyang du mar thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: / de lta na sems las byung ba rten yin pa'i phyir rten rnams kyang du mar thal lo zhe na /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dang lhan cig tu gyur pa yod pa ma yin gyi //

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gag pa dang rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i go skabs sbyin ba la rten zhes brjod de ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gag pa dang rnam par shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i go skabs sbyin ba la rten zhes brjod de ;
translated: The former consciousness ceases and the latter consciousness is born, and the former consciousness is called the support of the latter consciousness because it gives it an opportunity to arise.

original: de ltar na sems las byung ba rnams sems dang lhan cig 'gag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems las byung ba rnams sems dang lhan cig 'gag pa ni ma yin no //

translated: If you imagine that the eye, etc. are the support of consciousness because they are the door for the arising of consciousness, this is not certain, because whatever is the cause of consciousness is not its support.

analyzed: / gzhan du 'byung ba rnams kyang 'byung ba'i rten nyid du 'thob ste 'di yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not acceptable that the primary elements are the support of the primary elements, because they arise simultaneously.

original: gsung rab las lhan cig byung ba nyid kyi phyir sems nyid sems las byung ba'i rten nyid bshad do //
analyzed: gsung rab las lhan cig byung ba nyid kyi phyir sems nyid sems las byung ba'i rten nyid bshad do //
translated: The scriptures explain that mind is the support of mental factors because they occur simultaneously.

original: sems las byung ba rnams ni sems kyi rten ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams ni sems kyi rten ma yin no //
translated: But mental factors are not the support of mind.

analyzed: gzhan du na sems @42b dang sems byung ba'i rnam par gzhag pa 'chol bar 'gyur ro //

original: yang na mig la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la mig la sogs pa rnams chod pa yin kyang shugs kyis de dag gi sgra dang 'brel pa ltar te /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa 'di dag smos pa gang dag yin pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la mig la sogs pa rnams chod pa yin kyang shugs kyis de dag gi sgra dang 'brel pa ltar te /
translated: Or else, ‚Äúthose that are called the eye and so on‚Äù means that although the eye and so on are obstructed, their terms are related by implication,

analyzed: shugs kyis gsung rab las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa rna ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes dbang po dag gi rnam par shes pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the scriptures also teach the consciousnesses of the eye and so on by the term consciousness of the eye and so on.

analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa drug ma 'dres par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the six consciousnesses are taught without confusion.

analyzed: yul dag gis ma yin te der mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbyer med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not by objects because there is no distinction between eye consciousness and mental consciousness there.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ltar bshad na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang yang mthun par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ltar bshad na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang yang mthun par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Therefore, if it is explained in this way, it is also consistent with the text of the treatise.

original: 'o na de ltar rten phan tshun yin pa'i phyir nus pa mi 'gyur ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar rten phan tshun yin pa'i phyir nus pa mi 'gyur ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the supports are mutually dependent, is there no potency?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: The eye is the clear form that is the basis of the eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the eye consciousness?üîΩIt is the perception of form that is based on the eye.

original: mig la brten nas gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes 'di dag phan tshun rten ma yin par ches gzhan du rig par byas te des na de ni cig shos kyi shes byed do //
analyzed: mig la brten nas gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa'o zhes 'di dag phan tshun rten ma yin par ches gzhan du rig par byas te des na de ni cig shos kyi shes byed do //
translated: These are not mutually dependent, but are rather known to be different from each other. Therefore, the eye is the cause of the eye consciousness.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po dgag pa'i phyir tshig snga ma gzugs dang pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The first phrase, ‚Äúthe clear form that is the basis of the eye consciousness,‚Äù is stated in order to refute the ear faculty.

original: gang gi phyir de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi ngo bor med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi ngo bor med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist as the entity that is the basis of the eye consciousness.

original: de la mig la sogs pa nyid du thal ba med do //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa nyid du thal ba med do //
translated: It does not follow that it is the eye itself.

original: phyi ma ni bar chad med par 'gag pa'i rten dgag pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid la yang de'i gzugs dang ba'i rang bzhin med pas de la mig la sogs pa zhes bya bar thal ba med do //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bar chad med par 'gag pa'i rten dgag pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid la yang de'i gzugs dang ba'i rang bzhin med pas de la mig la sogs pa zhes bya bar thal ba med do //
translated: The second phrase, ‚Äúthe clear form that is the basis of the eye consciousness,‚Äù is stated in order to refute the basis of the eye consciousness that is uninterrupted cessation. Because it does not exist as the clear form that is the basis of the eye consciousness, it does not follow that it is the eye itself.

original: snga mas skal ba mnyam pa'i mig dang phyi mas de dang skal ba mnyam pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: snga mas skal ba mnyam pa'i mig dang phyi mas de dang skal ba mnyam pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The former is the eye of the same realm and the latter is of that realm.

original: gong du bshad pa'i ngag gi khyad par gyis yid dgag pa ma yin par shes par bya zhing yul gyi gzugs dang ba zhes pa'i skyon yang med do //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i ngag gi khyad par gyis yid dgag pa ma yin par shes par bya zhing yul gyi gzugs dang ba zhes pa'i skyon yang med do //
translated: It should be understood that the mind is not blocked by the special speech explained above, and there is no fault in saying that the object is clear form.

original: gal te de dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams la de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid med pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams la de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid med pas so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eye sense faculty is not the basis of consciousness of the same realm because it is not the basis of consciousness of the same realm,
