analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te nus pa'i shugs yongs su bzung bas bshad pa snga ma la ni gzugs smos pa don med pa can zhes bshad do // snga ma kho na'i gzugs dang ba'i @43a * //
translated: that is not so, because the former explanation is that it is meaningless to mention form in the statement that the eye sense faculty is the basis of consciousness that is clear form.

original: mtshan nyid kyi khyad par la yang mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun gyis tha dad ngo zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi khyad par la yang mig la sogs pa rnams phan tshun gyis tha dad ngo zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the eye sense faculty and so on are mutually distinct in terms of the specific characteristics of clear form alone, as explained previously.

original: 'o na 'dir bshad pa kho na de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir bshad pa kho na de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eye sense faculty is not the basis of consciousness of the same realm because it is not the basis of consciousness of the same realm,

original: de yang phan tshun thun mong du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid de mig la sogs pa rnams la bshad pa de ltar long ba la gzugs kyi blo med do //
analyzed: de yang phan tshun thun mong du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid de mig la sogs pa rnams la bshad pa de ltar long ba la gzugs kyi blo med do //
translated: Moreover, the eye, etc. are the common cause and effect of each other, as has been explained. Thus, the blind man does not have the idea of form.

original: yod pa rnams kyang rna ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yod pa rnams kyang rna ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have eyes do have it.

original: de bzhin du 'on pa la sogs pa rnams la yang sgra'i blo dag brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'on pa la sogs pa rnams la yang sgra'i blo dag brjod bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the deaf, etc.

original: phan tshun thun mong du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyang de'i rgyu'i dbye bas 'bras bu'i sa bon rnams la khyab ces bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun thun mong du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyang de'i rgyu'i dbye bas 'bras bu'i sa bon rnams la khyab ces bya'o //
translated: The common cause and effect of each other is also called the cause of the seed of the effect, because of the division of its cause.

original: mig la sogs pa dbye ba med pa rnams la dogs par mi rung ste rgyu tha dad du gyur ba'i phyir dang / tha dad du gyur pa'i rgyu rnams ni rgyu ma yin pa'i wang dang gling bu dang 'khar rnga la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la dbye ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbye ba med pa rnams la dogs par mi rung ste rgyu tha dad du gyur ba'i phyir dang / tha dad du gyur pa'i rgyu rnams ni rgyu ma yin pa'i wang dang gling bu dang 'khar rnga la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la dbye ba mthong ngo //
translated: It is not possible to doubt the indivisibility of the eye, etc., because of the difference of the cause, and because the different causes are seen to be the cause of the different effects, such as the sounds of the flute, the lute, the tabor, etc.

original: thams cad du tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi dbye ba sgrub pa dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid la yang 'dir dbye ba nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad du tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi dbye ba sgrub pa dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid la yang 'dir dbye ba nyid do //
translated: because they are not different in all aspects, the elements are established as having an undifferentiated characteristic.

original: nang dang phyi'i dbye ba bzhin nam tshor ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par la yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i dbye ba grub po //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dbye ba bzhin nam tshor ba bzhin du nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par la yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i dbye ba grub po //
translated: The distinction of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain is established in the experience of the internal and external distinctions, just as the distinction of feeling is.

original: 'o na de ltar tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams sgra bzhin du skye mched gcig tu thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams sgra bzhin du skye mched gcig tu thal lo zhe na /
translated: If they are not different, then, like sound, the eye and so on would be one base.

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin te rnam pa gzhan du skye mched rnam par bzhag pa'i phyir rigs gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgor gyur bas skye mched du rnam par gzhag bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin te rnam pa gzhan du skye mched rnam par bzhag pa'i phyir rigs gcig pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgor gyur bas skye mched du rnam par gzhag bar bya'i /
translated: This is not so, because the bases are established in another way. The bases should be established as the doors for the arising of consciousness of the same type.

original: rang gi ngo bo la bltos nas ni ma yin te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang skye mched gcig gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la bltos nas ni ma yin te tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang skye mched gcig gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not in terms of their own nature, because the characteristics of the different sense bases are included in a single sense base.

original: de la sgra bzhin du mig la sogs pa rnams skye mched gcig nyid du thal ba med do //
analyzed: de la sgra bzhin du mig la sogs pa rnams skye mched gcig nyid du thal ba med do //
translated: In this regard, it is not the case that, like sound, the eyes, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs ma yin pa'i dang pa'i bdag nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir dper na yid lta bu'o zhes zer ro //üîΩthams cad du bye brag pa sems can gcig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyis kyang 'di khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs ma yin pa'i dang pa'i bdag nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir dper na yid lta bu'o zhes zer ro // thams cad du bye brag pa sems can gcig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyis kyang 'di khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: Others say that the nature of the eye is not form because it is the basis of eye consciousness, like the mind.üîΩBut this is not so, because the eye is not the basis of all consciousness, and because the eye is not the basis of the mind‚Äôs consciousness.

original: @43b de grub par 'dod pa ni gnod byed du 'gal lo //
analyzed: @43b de grub par 'dod pa ni gnod byed du 'gal lo //
translated: If you accept that it is the basis of all consciousness, then you are contradicting your own tenets.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i phyir dpe dang sgrub byed ma tshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i phyir dpe dang sgrub byed ma tshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, your reason is unproven, and your example and proof are inadequate.

original: ser skya ba yang yon tan gsum gyis gtan tshigs dang khyab pa 'dod de gnod byed 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: ser skya ba yang yon tan gsum gyis gtan tshigs dang khyab pa 'dod de gnod byed 'gal ba'o //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya also asserts that the reason and the pervasion are established by the three qualities, but that is contradictory.

original: yid ni yon tan gsum zhes pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i bshad sbyar du rgya cher bstan pas der shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yid ni yon tan gsum zhes pa tshad ma kun las btus pa'i bshad sbyar du rgya cher bstan pas der shes par bya'o //
translated: The mind is the three qualities. This is taught extensively in the commentary on the compendium of valid knowledge. It should be understood there.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang 'dir ni gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs bsam brjod do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang 'dir ni gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs bsam brjod do //
translated: Here, I have not written about the unestablished reasons for fear of being verbose.

original: 'grel bshad 'di las gzhan nyid kyi phyir rten dang brten pa rnams la ni dbye ba mthong ste /
analyzed: 'grel bshad 'di las gzhan nyid kyi phyir rten dang brten pa rnams la ni dbye ba mthong ste /
translated: The divisions of the dependent and the supported are seen in other commentaries.

original: 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: They are like the divisions of a bowl and jujubes and so on.

original: na tsa sa aee pa ta syee b'a shra yo drishta aishto b'a dpe dang sgrub byed ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: na tsa sa aee pa ta syee b'a shra yo drishta aishto b'a dpe dang sgrub byed ma tshang ba'o //
translated: The example and the probandum are incomplete.

original: mig gi dbang po'i 'jug pa yid la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin te grangs can dang sangs rgyas pa'i khas blangs b'a dh'a /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i 'jug pa yid la brten nas 'jug pa ma yin te grangs can dang sangs rgyas pa'i khas blangs b'a dh'a /
translated: The engagement of the eye faculty is not engaged in dependence on the mind because it is accepted by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and the Buddhist.

original: mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis mig la sogs pa gzugs dang ba nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the BhagavƒÅn said in the s≈´tras that the eye and so on are just form.

original: gzhan dag ni gzugs ma yin pa dang ba'i bdag nyid mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po bzhin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzugs ma yin pa dang ba'i bdag nyid mig la sogs pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po bzhin zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the eye and so on are not form because they are faculties, like the mental faculty.

original: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid las ldog pas gzhan ma yin pa'i mig la sogs pa yod do zhes bya ba ni rten ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid las ldog pas gzhan ma yin pa'i mig la sogs pa yod do zhes bya ba ni rten ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is unestablished, because the eye and so on are not different from form.

original: gzhan du na gzhan gyi ngo bor khas blangs pa'i gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan gyi ngo bor khas blangs pa'i gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid dgag par bya'o //
translated: If they were different, the form that is accepted as their nature would have to be refuted.üîΩAnd if they were different, the reason would be unestablished, because the basis is accepted as existing.

original: de bzhin du yang rten ma grub par gyur pa de khas blangs pa'i phyir yod kyang rung de la dbang po nyid rab tu ma grub pas phyogs chos dang gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rten ma grub par gyur pa de khas blangs pa'i phyir yod kyang rung de la dbang po nyid rab tu ma grub pas phyogs chos dang gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: Even if it exists, the property of the position and the reason are not established, because the nature of a faculty is not established.

original: nges par gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis mig la sogs pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis mig la sogs pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye and so on must definitely be accepted as having the nature of form.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid rnam par chad pa'i gzhi bstan pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du song ba'i phyir dbang po rnams rnam par chad pa'i gzhi bstan pa nyid rab tu ma grub po //üîΩde ltar yang ltas sbyin la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bram ze rnams kyi dbang po'i gnas su yod ces khas blang ba'i phyir bram ze'i dbang po dang dbang po'i gnas gang yin pa de rnams de nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de'i gnas su 'jug pa'i phyir
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid rnam par chad pa'i gzhi bstan pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du song ba'i phyir dbang po rnams rnam par chad pa'i gzhi bstan pa nyid rab tu ma grub po // de ltar yang ltas sbyin la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bram ze rnams kyi dbang po'i gnas su yod ces khas blang ba'i phyir bram ze'i dbang po dang dbang po'i gnas gang yin pa de rnams de nyid las gzhan ma yin pa de'i gnas su 'jug pa'i phyir
translated: The sense faculties are not established as the basis of the obstruction of the body because they are obstructed and because they pervade everything.üîΩThus, the sense faculties such as the eyes exist in the sense faculties of the brahmans, because it is accepted that they exist in the sense faculties of the brahmans.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin @44a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin @44a * //
translated: The sense faculties and the sense faculties of the brahmans are not different from each other, because they are engaged in the same object.

original: lus las phyi rol ma yin no //
analyzed: lus las phyi rol ma yin no //
translated: They are not external to the body,üîΩlike form and so on.üîΩThe sense faculties such as the eyes are engaged in doubt and so on, like a vine and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams de la the tshom la sogs pa rab tu sbyor las sam shing gel ba la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ste spros pas chog go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams de la the tshom la sogs pa rab tu sbyor las sam shing gel ba la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ste spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this elaboration!

original: gzugs kyi phung po rdzas bcu gcig pa bstan pa las dbang po lnga rnams bshad pa byas zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po rdzas bcu gcig pa bstan pa las dbang po lnga rnams bshad pa byas zin to //
translated: The eleven substances of the form aggregate have been explained, and the five faculties have been explained.

original: de'i mjug thogs su de dag gi don rnams bshad par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su de dag gi don rnams bshad par bya dgos te /
translated: Immediately after that, the meanings of those should be explained.

original: de'i phyir dbang po lnga rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po lnga rnams bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, the five faculties have been explained.

original: don lnga rnams bshad par bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: don lnga rnams bshad par bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The five objects should be explained, so it is said:

original: de la zhes pa dbang po dang don de rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa dbang po dang don de rnams la'o //
translated: Among those, in regard to those faculties and objects.

original: re zhig gi sgra ni rim pa'i don te re zhig gzugs bstan par bya dgos pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig gi sgra ni rim pa'i don te re zhig gzugs bstan par bya dgos pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù means in order. First, form should be explained.

original: gzugs rnam gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs rnam gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúForm is of two kinds‚Äù means of two types.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul dag go zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pas de dag gi mtshan nyid ma brjod par de dag gi dbye ba kho na ston te de ni 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul dag go zhes 'jig rten na rab tu grags pas de dag gi mtshan nyid ma brjod par de dag gi dbye ba kho na ston te de ni 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since form and so on are well known in the world as the objects of the eye and so on, their characteristics are not stated. Only their divisions are taught, because they are well known in the world.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po sdud do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po sdud do //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúblue, etc.‚Äù include yellow, red, and white.

original: gzhan dag ni de'i bye brag go zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi bye brag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de'i bye brag go zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi bye brag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The others are its varieties. The meaning is that they are varieties of the colors blue, etc.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sprin dang du ba rdul dang khug rna dang grib ma dang nyi ma dang snang ba dang mun pa'o //
analyzed: sprin dang du ba rdul dang khug rna dang grib ma dang nyi ma dang snang ba dang mun pa'o //
translated: They are clouds, smoke, dust, mist, shadow, sunshine, light, and darkness.

original: de ltar byas na kha dog rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na kha dog rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are twelve types of color.

original: rtsa ba'i kha dog bzhi dang / de dag shas che ba dang / shas chung ba dang 'brel ba'i bye brag gis sprin la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i kha dog bzhi dang / de dag shas che ba dang / shas chung ba dang 'brel ba'i bye brag gis sprin la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: The four primary colors, and the eight secondary colors, such as clouds, etc., are distinguished by their predominance or paucity, or by their combination.

original: kha cig na re nam mkha'i khams kyi bye brag kho na yin gyi kha dog gzhan ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re nam mkha'i khams kyi bye brag kho na yin gyi kha dog gzhan ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some believe that they are simply varieties of the element of space and not separate colors.

original: grib ma dang mun pa ni 'od la gnod pa byas pas skyed pa'o //
analyzed: grib ma dang mun pa ni 'od la gnod pa byas pas skyed pa'o //
translated: Shadow and darkness are produced by the obstruction of light.

original: 'dir khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between shadow and darkness is this.

original: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
analyzed: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang ba'o //
translated: Shadow is where forms appear.

original: bzlog pa ni mun pa ste gang na gzugs rnams mi snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mun pa ste gang na gzugs rnams mi snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Darkness is the opposite of that, where forms do not appear.

original: rnam par ma phye'o zhes pa ni rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma phye'o zhes pa ni rnam par dbye ba ma byas pa'o //
translated: Undivided means not distinguished.üîΩThere is a form base that exists as color but not as shape.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog tu yod la dbyibs su med pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la dbyibs zhes bya ba 'di yang ci ma bshad pa'i ring po la sogs pa'o zhes de nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kha dog tu yod la dbyibs su med pa yang yod de zhes bya ba la dbyibs zhes bya ba 'di yang ci ma bshad pa'i ring po la sogs pa'o zhes de nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: This is what should be understood: What is called ‚Äúshape‚Äù is also long, etc., which have not been explained.

original: gang la ring po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur @44b ba de ni ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs so //
analyzed: gang la ring po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur @44b ba de ni ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs so //
translated: That which is the cognition of long, etc., is the shape of long, etc.

original: de ltar na kha dog la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dbyibs khas blang bar bya ba ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ltar na kha dog la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dbyibs khas blang bar bya ba ci'i phyir na /
translated: Thus, why should shape be accepted as different from color, etc.?

original: gang las phyogs gcig gi sgo nas 'jug pa kha dog gi tshogs mang ba la ring po'i blor zhing /
analyzed: gang las phyogs gcig gi sgo nas 'jug pa kha dog gi tshogs mang ba la ring po'i blor zhing /
translated: When there is a multitude of colors that engage through one part, there is the cognition of long.

original: nyung ba la thung ngu'i blo dang phyogs bzhi mnyam pa la gru bzhi'i blo dang / phyogs kun nas mnyam pa la zlum po'i blo dang / dbus su phal che ba la mtho ba'i blo dang / nyung ba la dma' ba'i blo dang / kha phyogs gcig tu phyogs pa la phya le ba'i blo dang /
analyzed: nyung ba la thung ngu'i blo dang phyogs bzhi mnyam pa la gru bzhi'i blo dang / phyogs kun nas mnyam pa la zlum po'i blo dang / dbus su phal che ba la mtho ba'i blo dang / nyung ba la dma' ba'i blo dang / kha phyogs gcig tu phyogs pa la phya le ba'i blo dang /
translated: The mind that apprehends short arises in relation to a small number, the mind that apprehends square arises in relation to the four directions being equal, the mind that apprehends round arises in relation to all directions being equal, the mind that apprehends high arises in relation to the center being larger and the mind that apprehends low arises in relation to the periphery being smaller, the mind that apprehends straight arises in relation to the direction being oriented in one direction and the mind that apprehends crooked arises in relation to the direction being oriented in various directions.

original: phyogs tha dad par phyogs pa la yang phya le ba ma yin pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs tha dad par phyogs pa la yang phya le ba ma yin pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind of shortness arises in regard to a small quantity, the mind of squareness arises in regard to an equal number of sides, the mind of roundness arises in regard to an equal number of directions, the mind of height arises in regard to a large number in the middle, the mind of depth arises in regard to a small number, the mind of straightness arises in regard to an orientation in one direction, and the mind of crookedness arises in regard to an orientation in different directions.

original: ci ltar yang 'di rtogs par bya zhen /üîΩkha dog la sogs pa'i spyi la ring po la sogs pa'i blo ma yin yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i dbyibs zhes dang / reg par byed pa'i sgo nas kyang ring po la sogs pa'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: ci ltar yang 'di rtogs par bya zhen / kha dog la sogs pa'i spyi la ring po la sogs pa'i blo ma yin yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i dbyibs zhes dang / reg par byed pa'i sgo nas kyang ring po la sogs pa'i blo skye'o //
translated: How is this understood?üîΩAlthough the mind of length, etc. does not arise in regard to the universals of color, etc., the mind of shape arises in regard to a different object, and the mind of length, etc. arises in regard to contact.

original: gzhan dbang po'i yul ma yin pa dang dbang po las 'das pa'i sgo nas kyang blo skye ba 'di dbang po'i shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dbang po'i yul ma yin pa dang dbang po las 'das pa'i sgo nas kyang blo skye ba 'di dbang po'i shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind arises in regard to what is not an object of the sense faculties and in regard to what is beyond the sense faculties, but this is not a sense consciousness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ste de'i dri las me tog gi kha dog shes pa bzhin dri yang me tog gi kha dog las nges par de lta bu'i reg bya gang ci yang rung ba 'di ni dbyibs ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ste de'i dri las me tog gi kha dog shes pa bzhin dri yang me tog gi kha dog las nges par de lta bu'i reg bya gang ci yang rung ba 'di ni dbyibs ma yin no //
translated: What then? It is the cognition of inference, just as one knows the color of a flower from its scent, so one knows the shape from the color.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i dbang po'i sgo nas bum pa la sogs pa bzhin ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi shes pa 'jug pa de kha dog la sogs pa rnams las don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i dbang po'i sgo nas bum pa la sogs pa bzhin ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi shes pa 'jug pa de kha dog la sogs pa rnams las don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of shape, such as long, etc., with regard to a pot, etc., is not a separate object from color, etc., because it arises from the cognition of color, etc., just like the cognition of the color of a flower from the scent of the flower.

original: 'di ni phyogs las bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas su yang rnam par dpyod bar 'gyur te spros pas chog go //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs las bstan pa'i mdzod kyi gnas su yang rnam par dpyod bar 'gyur te spros pas chog go //
translated: This will be analyzed in the chapter on the Abhidharmako≈õa, but enough of this digression.

original: gnyi gar yod pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed ma gtogs pa ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang / sprin dang du ba dang rdul dang khug rna'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar yod pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed ma gtogs pa ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang / sprin dang du ba dang rdul dang khug rna'o //
translated: Shape exists in two ways: shape that exists in both ways, such as long, etc., and shape that exists in one way, such as the shape of a cloud, smoke, dust, and mist.

original: gzhan dag na re nyi ma dang snang ba kho na kha dog tu yod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nyi ma dang snang ba kho na kha dog tu yod kyi /
translated: Others say: Only the sun and light exist as color.

original: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang grib ma dang mun pa zhes bya pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang grib ma dang mun pa zhes bya pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But it is not called blue, yellow, red, white, shadow, or light.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs ma gtogs par sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs ma gtogs par sngon po la sogs pa 'dzin pa med do //
translated: Why? Because apart from the shape of long, etc., there is no perception of blue, etc.

original: ci ltar mun pa la ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs 'dzin cing spyod pa la sogs pa rnams la mthar de bzhin du yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar mun pa la ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs 'dzin cing spyod pa la sogs pa rnams la mthar de bzhin du yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as in darkness, etc., the shape of long, etc., is perceived, so too it is delimited in light, etc.

original: @45a * // gal te de lta na nyi ma dang snang ba gnyis la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na thal ba med de /
analyzed: @45a * // gal te de lta na nyi ma dang snang ba gnyis la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na thal ba med de /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that light and the sun are not different.

original: snang ba dang nyi ma au pa gha rten gyi dbyibs su gzung ba'i phyir de mun pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang nyi ma au pa gha rten gyi dbyibs su gzung ba'i phyir de mun pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: There is no such fault, because light and the sun are grasped as the shape of the support of light, and it is said that light does not exist in darkness.

original: ji ltar na rdzas gcig la rdzas gnyi gar yod ce na zhes bya ba ni 'di yod pa'i don du khas blangs nas rgol ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na rdzas gcig la rdzas gnyi gar yod ce na zhes bya ba ni 'di yod pa'i don du khas blangs nas rgol ba'o //
translated: How can both substances exist in one substance? This is an objection raised by one who accepts that the existence of one is the nonexistence of the other.

original: gnyi gar ni rnam pa gnyi gar ro //
analyzed: gnyi gar ni rnam pa gnyi gar ro //
translated: Both is both aspects.

original: 'di ltar rang ngo bo tha dad pas ni rdzas tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang ngo bo tha dad pas ni rdzas tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are different substances because they have different natures.

original: de'i phyir de la gcig nyid 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gcig nyid 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, oneness is contradicted in that case.

original: de la gcig nyid la ngo bo'i dbye ba med pas na de'i phyir snang ba la sogs pa bzhin nam lus kyi rnam par rig byed bzhin du dbyibs dang kha dog gi sgo nas de nyid dam de khas blang bar bya'i gnyi ga ji lta ba bzhin ma
analyzed: de la gcig nyid la ngo bo'i dbye ba med pas na de'i phyir snang ba la sogs pa bzhin nam lus kyi rnam par rig byed bzhin du dbyibs dang kha dog gi sgo nas de nyid dam de khas blang bar bya'i gnyi ga ji lta ba bzhin ma
translated: Since there is no differentiation of nature in oneness, therefore, like light, etc., or like bodily intimation, it should be accepted as just that or as both by way of shape and color, but not as both in reality.

original: yin no // de la gnyi ga mngon pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni rdzas gcig la ste kha dog la yang dbyibs dang dbyibs la yang kha dog mngon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin no // de la gnyi ga mngon pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba ni rdzas gcig la ste kha dog la yang dbyibs dang dbyibs la yang kha dog mngon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are manifest there, means because both shape and color are manifest there in one substance.

original: yod pa 'di shes pa'i don yin gyi yod pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa 'di shes pa'i don yin gyi yod pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'di skad du gnyi ga mngon pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is said: because both are manifest.

original: gang kha dog kho nar yod la dbyibs su ma yin pa nyid yod pa'o zhes bshad pa der ni yod pa'i don nyid spyi la brten pa'i phyir yod pa'i don du yang mi 'gal lo zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gang kha dog kho nar yod la dbyibs su ma yin pa nyid yod pa'o zhes bshad pa der ni yod pa'i don nyid spyi la brten pa'i phyir yod pa'i don du yang mi 'gal lo zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: But in the passage where it is said that it exists as color alone and not as shape, the meaning of existence is based on the universal, so it is not contradictory to say that it exists in the sense of existing.

original: spyi'i dngos po gcig la mtshan nyid 'dod nyod pa nyid 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs pa'i phyir aa ka wa na /
analyzed: spyi'i dngos po gcig la mtshan nyid 'dod nyod pa nyid 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba 'di gzugs kyi skye mched du gsungs pa'i phyir aa ka wa na /

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga rdzas gcig pa ji lta ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga rdzas gcig pa ji lta ba ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that it is not the case that both are the same substance.

translated: The remaining form base that is different from the sun and light is shape and color that are inseparable and combined, which are either derived from the cause of karmic maturation, derived from the cause of enhancement, or derived from the cause of natural outcome.

analyzed: 'dir spyi kho na gnyis ka lta bur mngon te rdzas ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gzhan du rdzas 'gal ba gnyi ga'i rang bzhin la mi 'jug go //
translated: Otherwise, a substance that is the nature of both would not be tenable.

translated: Here, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says: The atom of the desire realm, which is endowed with eight substances, is the smallest unit that can be useful, because it arises from a collection that is not different from it, and because it is not devoid of a collection of smell, etc.

original: // sgra ni rnam pa brgyad yod de //
analyzed: // sgra ni rnam pa brgyad yod de //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dis dngos po rnams sgrog par byed pas na sgra'o //

original: yang na grag par byed pas sgra'o //üîΩbde bar gshegs pa pa dag na re rna ba'i yul du gyur pa'i gzugs 'byung ba @46a * //
analyzed: yang na grag par byed pas sgra'o // bde bar gshegs pa pa dag na re rna ba'i yul du gyur pa'i gzugs 'byung ba @46a * //
translated: Or, it is that which is sounded.

original: bzhi las grub pa'o zhes zer ro //üîΩde la zin pa dag ni lus su gtogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi las grub pa'o zhes zer ro // de la zin pa dag ni lus su gtogs pa rnams te /
translated: The Sugata school says that sound is a form that is the object of the ear sense faculty and is derived from the four great elements.

original: phan tshun mthun bar byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi rten gyi dngos por nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun mthun bar byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi rten gyi dngos por nye bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among those, the conjoined are those that are part of the body, because they are mutually compatible, and because they are held to be the basis of mind and mental factors.

original: de ni mig la sogs pa da ltar byung ba dang tha dad pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste bzlog pa ni ma zin pa dag go //
analyzed: de ni mig la sogs pa da ltar byung ba dang tha dad pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste bzlog pa ni ma zin pa dag go //
translated: They are the present eye, etc., which are different from the present great elements, and are born from the maturation of karma and from growth. The opposite are the not appropriated great elements.

original: de dag gang la rgyur yod pas na zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gang la rgyur yod pas na zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: They are called born from the cause of the appropriated great elements because they exist as the cause of the appropriated great elements.

original: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The great elements that are born from the cause of the appropriated great elements are like this.

original: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lag pa dang ngag gi sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, the sound of hands and speech.

original: gal te ngag gi sgra ma yin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ngag gi sgra ma yin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the great elements that are not the cause of the sound of speech do not exist,

original: dper na tshangs pa 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pas smras pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na tshangs pa 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pas smras pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa rnams kyi ngag gi rnam par rig byed lta bu ste /
translated: for example, the speech of Brahma who belongs to the desire realm, and the verbal expression of those born in the second concentration,

original: rnam rig dpyod dang bcas dag na //
analyzed: rnam rig dpyod dang bcas dag na //
translated: are born from the cause of the appropriated great elements.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de ltar sgra ni 'byung ba rgyur byas pa lus dang ngag gi las zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de ltar sgra ni 'byung ba rgyur byas pa lus dang ngag gi las zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and because sound is the characteristic of contaminated action of body and speech that is derived from the primary elements.

original: yod mod kyi 'di ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: yod mod kyi 'di ni nyes pa med de /
translated: This is not a fault,

original: dpe nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dir lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu kho na las byung ba yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe nyid du nye bar blangs pa'i phyir dang / 'dir lag pa dang ngag gi sgra ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu kho na las byung ba yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taken as an example, and because it is ascertained that the sound of hand and speech arises only from the cause of the appropriated primary elements.

original: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
translated: Sound that is indicative of sentient beings is the sound of verbal indicative action.

original: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra las gzhan pa zin pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can rnam pa gnyis char yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra las gzhan pa zin pa ma yin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can rnam pa gnyis char yang ngo //
translated: Other than that is not indicative of sentient beings, which is the two types that are derived from the cause of the primary elements that are not appropriated.

original: de ltar na zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can gnyis re re zhing sems can du ston pa dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu can gnyis re re zhing sems can du ston pa dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi yin la /
translated: Thus, there are four types of sound, because each of the two, that is, that which is caused by the primary elements that are conjoined and that which is caused by the primary elements that are not conjoined, is either indicative of sentient beings or not indicative of sentient beings.

original: rnam pa bzhi po yang re re zhing yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po yang re re zhing yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: Each of the four types is further divided into two types, pleasant and unpleasant. Thus, there are eight types of sound.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mthun pa ste mar 'dzin pa dang phar 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni yid dang mthun pa ste mar 'dzin pa dang phar 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: Pleasant sound is agreeable, like the sound of a mother or father.

original: 'dir rgyu'i dbye ba dang rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba las sgra'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu'i dbye ba dang rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba las sgra'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Here, the definition of sound is taught from the point of view of its cause and its nature.

original: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang ma zin ba'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las gyur pa'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zin pa dang ma zin ba'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las gyur pa'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Others say that there is also sound that is caused by the primary elements that are conjoined and not conjoined.

original: de @46b la lag pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni zin pa'o //
analyzed: de @46b la lag pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni zin pa'o //
translated: The primary elements of the hand are conjoined.

original: rdza rnga'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: rdza rnga'i 'byung ba chen po dag ni ma zin pa'o //
translated: The primary elements of the clay drum are not conjoined.

original: lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las 'byung ba gnyi ga la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir zin pa dang ma zin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las 'byung ba gnyi ga la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir zin pa dang ma zin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //

original: de ni ci ltar kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig la zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni ci ltar kha dog gi rdul phra rab gcig la zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How is that?

analyzed: lag pa dang rdza rnga phrad pa las skyes pa'i sgra'i rdul phra rab ni 'byung ba bzhi chen gnyis rgyur byas pa las skyes pa ma yin te rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir kha dog gi rdul phra rab bzhin no //
translated: A subtle particle of sound that arises from the contact of the hand and the drum is not derived from the two great elements, because it is derived form, like a subtle particle of color.

original: lus dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not distinct from the body.

original: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gnyis ni phan tshun lhan cig pa'i rgyu nyid do zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gnyis ni phan tshun lhan cig pa'i rgyu nyid do zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says that two sets of four elements are mutually coexistent causes.

original: de las cir 'gyur na de'i rigs dang tha dad par 'gyur zhing de las kyang thogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur na de'i rigs dang tha dad par 'gyur zhing de las kyang thogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: What would be the problem with that? It would be distinct from its type and it would be impeded.

original: na nu tsa pri thi p'i dh'a tor bh'a tu n'a bi ma bh'a go na ce na sa pra ti gha tva mi ti tsi na tyam me ta ta /
analyzed: na nu tsa pri thi p'i dh'a tor bh'a tu n'a bi ma bh'a go na ce na sa pra ti gha tva mi ti tsi na tyam me ta ta /
translated: If you ask, Why is it not shared in the realm of the Nupcaprithidevas? it is because they are not of the same realm as those who have attained the first concentration and above.

original: 'byung ba bzhi chen gnyis kyis sprul pa'i rdul phra rab ni phyi ste de la zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba mi 'gal lo zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi chen gnyis kyis sprul pa'i rdul phra rab ni phyi ste de la zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba mi 'gal lo zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: The master Samghabhadra says: The external subtle particles of the two great elements that are emanated by the four great elements are called derived from the great elements that are and are not conjoined.üîΩThere is no contradiction in calling them derived from the great elements that are and are not conjoined.

original: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du mi ston pa ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du mi ston pa ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called sentient and non-sentient because they arise from the great elements that are conjoined and not conjoined.üîΩIf form and so on are classified as pleasant and unpleasant, then why are only sounds classified as two types?

original: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye ba gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang yod na sgra kho na rnam pa gnyis zhe na zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye ba gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang yod na sgra kho na rnam pa gnyis zhe na zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from the great elements that are conjoined and not conjoined.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba bzhin gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba bzhin gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that form, etc. arise from the cause of the elements that are conjoined and not conjoined, like what is pleasant and unpleasant?

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi bzhin du sgra'i rgyu kho na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi bzhin du sgra'i rgyu kho na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of sound is twofold, like that of form, etc.

original: rang gi ngo bo la yang de ltar bstan bcos su smos pa sgra'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la yang de ltar bstan bcos su smos pa sgra'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The treatise declares the definition of sound to be:

original: de'i phyir ldog pa'i dbye bas kha dog dang dbyibs la brjod pa bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa'i dbye bas kha dog dang dbyibs la brjod pa bzhin du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, like color and shape, it is described by way of the classification of its reversal.

original: gzhan la yang dbye ba yod de /
analyzed: gzhan la yang dbye ba yod de /
translated: But there is also a classification of other sounds.

original: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni sems can la sogs pa'i 'du byed las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni sems can la sogs pa'i 'du byed las skyes pa'o //
translated: Those that arise from the cause of the great elements that are conjoined are produced from the formative forces of sentient beings.

original: de la nges par bltos pa sems can gyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skyes pa de yang lag pa la sogs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las skyes pa'am ngag gi @47a * //
analyzed: de la nges par bltos pa sems can gyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skyes pa de yang lag pa la sogs pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las skyes pa'am ngag gi @47a * //
translated: Those that definitely depend on the formative forces of sentient beings are produced from the formative forces of the hand, etc. or from the formative forces of speech.

original: rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed do //
translated: They are the intimation of speech.

original: ngag gi rnam bar rig byed kyang ming gi gnas rnams la bltos pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi rnam bar rig byed kyang ming gi gnas rnams la bltos pa'o //
translated: And verbal intimation is based on the bases of names.

original: de ltar dge ba la sogs pa'i dge bas dbye ba rnam pa mang du yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba la sogs pa'i dge bas dbye ba rnam pa mang du yod ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, there are many types of classification of virtue and so on.

original: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du mi ston pa dag re re yang zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni mi 'khrul ba'i phyir so sor mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du mi ston pa dag re re yang zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni mi 'khrul ba'i phyir so sor mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: Both that which indicates sentient beings and that which does not indicate sentient beings arise from the cause of the great elements that are conjoined and not conjoined to the mind, respectively, because they are nonerroneous.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs lta bu 'khrul pa la yang re zhig sngon po la sogs pa dang ring po la sogs pa so sor mngon par brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs lta bu 'khrul pa la yang re zhig sngon po la sogs pa dang ring po la sogs pa so sor mngon par brjod par 'dod do //
translated: Even in error, such as color and shape, it is asserted that blue and so on and long and so on are individually expressed.

original: 'dir ni 'khrul pa la yang mi 'dod do zhes pa rgyu med bar shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'khrul pa la yang mi 'dod do zhes pa rgyu med bar shes bar bya'o //
translated: But here it is not asserted that they are individually expressed even in error. This should be understood as the reason.

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang ring po la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ldog pas sprin la sogs pa rnams la med kyang logs su bstan bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang ring po la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs kyi ldog pas sprin la sogs pa rnams la med kyang logs su bstan bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Even though blue and so on and long and so on do not exist in clouds and so on due to the exclusion of color and shape, they should be understood to be separately indicated.

original: 'dir rgyu shes bar bya ba ma yin te bstan bcos phyogs su lhung ba rgyu'i bye brag bshad pa dang ma bshad par gyur pa zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu shes bar bya ba ma yin te bstan bcos phyogs su lhung ba rgyu'i bye brag bshad pa dang ma bshad par gyur pa zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyu bzhin no //
translated: Here, the cause is not to be known, because the treatise is partial, like the explanation and non-explanation of the specific causes, and the cause of the grasped and ungrasped elements.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba nyid gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes pa de yang dgongs par mngon pa'i phyir 'di slob dpon gyi dgongs pa'o snyam nas 'dir 'di ltar rab tu phye zhing yongs su bshad do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba nyid gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang zhes pa de yang dgongs par mngon pa'i phyir 'di slob dpon gyi dgongs pa'o snyam nas 'dir 'di ltar rab tu phye zhing yongs su bshad do //
translated: The pleasant and unpleasant as explained also apply to form and so on. Since that is also intended, thinking this is the master's intention, it is distinguished and explained here in this way.

original: ro ni rnam drug ces bya ba la myang bar bya bas na ro ste ro myang bar bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ro ni rnam drug ces bya ba la myang bar bya bas na ro ste ro myang bar bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Taste is of six kinds. That which is to be tasted is taste, meaning that which is to be experienced as taste.

original: rang bzhin gyi bye brag khas blangs nas bye brag drug bstan gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bye brag khas blangs nas bye brag drug bstan gyi /
translated: Having accepted the distinction of nature, six distinctions are taught.

original: dbye ba gzhan ni de dag sbyar bya'i bye brag las mtha' yas pas ma brjod do //
analyzed: dbye ba gzhan ni de dag sbyar bya'i bye brag las mtha' yas pas ma brjod do //
translated: Other divisions are not mentioned because they are limitless due to the distinctions of what is to be combined.

original: go rims tha dad pa ni de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba nges pa med par bstan bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims tha dad pa ni de'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba nges pa med par bstan bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The order is different because it is to demonstrate that the consciousness that has them as its object is not definitely generated in that order.

original: dri rnam bzhi zhes bya ba la bsnam par bya bas na dri ste de yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dri rnam bzhi zhes bya ba la bsnam par bya bas na dri ste de yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Odor is that which is smelled. It is of four kinds:

original: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dag dri mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dag dri mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and those that are neither, because they are equal or unequal.

original: rigs las ni dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do //üîΩyang bstan bcos las gsum pa dri mnyam pa bshad pa de ni kha cig dri zhim pa'i phyogs su bslan bar bya la /
analyzed: rigs las ni dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes ston par byed do // yang bstan bcos las gsum pa dri mnyam pa bshad pa de ni kha cig dri zhim pa'i phyogs su bslan bar bya la /
translated: The treatise mentions only two kinds, pleasant and unpleasant, because it is a general statement about the types of odor.

original: kha cig dri nga ba'i phyogs su bslan par bya ba yin pas rigs las gsum pa yon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig dri nga ba'i phyogs su bslan par bya ba yin pas rigs las gsum pa yon pa ma yin no //
translated: The treatise mentions a third kind, equal odor, but some say that is placed in the category of pleasant odor and some say it is placed in the category of unpleasant odor. Therefore it is not a third type.

original: de yang mnyam pa las byung ba dang ma mnyam @47b ba las byung ba yang rung ste rten la btags pa'i 'jug pa'i dbye ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de yang mnyam pa las byung ba dang ma mnyam @47b ba las byung ba yang rung ste rten la btags pa'i 'jug pa'i dbye ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: It is another type of engagement that is imputed to the basis, whether it arises from equality or from inequality.

original: gzhan dag bstan bcos su rnam pa gsum ni shas chung ba dang che ba'i dbye ba las yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag bstan bcos su rnam pa gsum ni shas chung ba dang che ba'i dbye ba las yin te /
translated: Others say: The three types in the treatise are from the perspective of the difference between weak and strong smells.

original: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dang dri mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dang dri mnyam pa'o //
translated: They are pleasant smell, unpleasant smell and neutral smell.

original: bstan bcos su yang dri mi mnyam ba dang dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba ma bshad la /
analyzed: bstan bcos su yang dri mi mnyam ba dang dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba ma bshad la /
translated: The treatise does not explain neutral smell, pleasant smell and unpleasant smell.

original: de las gzhan pa thun mong du dri zhim pa bshad cing /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa thun mong du dri zhim pa bshad cing /
translated: It explains pleasant smell in general and not as different from that.

original: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dag las tha dad pa kho nar dri mnyam pa bstan bcos su bshad do zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dag las tha dad pa kho nar dri mnyam pa bstan bcos su bshad do zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: The treatise explains neutral smell as different from pleasant smell and unpleasant smell.

original: de la dbang bo'i 'byung ba chen po dang ting nge 'dzin rgyas par byed ba ni dri zhim ba'o ;
analyzed: de la dbang bo'i 'byung ba chen po dang ting nge 'dzin rgyas par byed ba ni dri zhim ba'o ;
translated: Some say: The great elements of the sense faculty and the smell that increases concentration is pleasant smell.

original: / bzlog pa ni dri nga ba'o //
analyzed: / bzlog pa ni dri nga ba'o //
translated: The opposite is unpleasant smell.

original: khyad par de gnyis ka med pa ni dri mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par de gnyis ka med pa ni dri mnyam pa'o //
translated: The homogeneous touch is the one that is neither of these two.

original: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The tangible has eleven types.

original: reg par bya ba yin pas na reg bya'am lus kyi dbang pos reg par nus pas reg bya'o //
analyzed: reg par bya ba yin pas na reg bya'am lus kyi dbang pos reg par nus pas reg bya'o //
translated: The tangible is that which is to be touched, or it is the tangible because it is capable of being touched by the body faculty.

original: gal te gang gis gang la reg ba de la yang des reg pas na lus kyi dbang po yang reg byar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis gang la reg ba de la yang des reg pas na lus kyi dbang po yang reg byar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the body faculty is touched by something, then it is also touched by that.

original: lus kyi dbang po ni reg bar byed pa yin gyi reg par bya ba ni ma yin te mig bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po ni reg bar byed pa yin gyi reg par bya ba ni ma yin te mig bzhin no //
translated: The body faculty is that which touches, not that which is touched, like the eye.

analyzed: mig ni lta bar byed pa yin gyi blta bar bya ba ni ma yin no //üîΩ'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig la reg pa'am rten dang dmigs pa bar ma chad pa ni reg pa'i 'du shes de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa la yul dmigs pa ni de yul dang bcas pa la reg pas nye bar spyod kyi /

original: yul dang rnam par shes ba'i rten gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang rnam par shes ba'i rten gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as the support of the sense-faculty and of consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lus kyi dbang pos 'byung ba rnams nyid la reg par byed pas nye bar spyod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lus kyi dbang pos 'byung ba rnams nyid la reg par byed pas nye bar spyod do //
translated: Thus, the body sense-faculty experiences the primary elements by means of contact.

original: de la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pas mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pas mi 'dzin no //
translated: The consciousness does not grasp the form, etc. which are supported by the body.

original: me tog la sogs pa rnams la yang kha dog la gnod ba las de'i rten la gnod kyi lus reg pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa rnams la yang kha dog la gnod ba las de'i rten la gnod kyi lus reg pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: In the case of flowers, etc., the harm to the color is due to the harm to the support, but not to the contact with the body.

original: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyen pa'o zhes bya ba la 'jam pa kho na 'jam pa nyid de so sos kho na so so nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyen pa'o zhes bya ba la 'jam pa kho na 'jam pa nyid de so sos kho na so so nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Smoothness is softness. Smoothness is the same as smoothness, just as sharpness is the same as sharpness.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni sbrel bar bya bas na 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni sbrel bar bya bas na 'jam pa'o //
translated: The etymology of smoothness is as follows: it is smooth because it is to be spread out.

original: mnyen pa ni rud rud po ma yin ba ste sped par bzod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mnyen pa ni rud rud po ma yin ba ste sped par bzod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Softness is the opposite of roughness; it is what is called ‚Äúpliable.‚Äù

original: rtsub pa nyid ni rud rud po'o zhes bya ba la rtsub pa 'di la yod pas rtsub pa ste spu can @48a * //
analyzed: rtsub pa nyid ni rud rud po'o zhes bya ba la rtsub pa 'di la yod pas rtsub pa ste spu can @48a * //
translated: Roughness is roughness. Roughness is that which has roughness; it is what is called ‚Äúhairy.‚Äù

original: bzhin no // rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rnam grangs te rtsub pa kho na rtsub pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzhin no // rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rnam grangs te rtsub pa kho na rtsub pa nyid do //
translated: Roughness itself is roughness.

original: rud rud po ni gyong po ste shin tu 'jam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rud rud po ni gyong po ste shin tu 'jam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Roughness is hard, not soft at all.üîΩWeight is that by which things are heavy.

original: lci ba nyid gang gis na dngos po rnams 'jam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dma' bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lci ba nyid gang gis na dngos po rnams 'jam pa'o zhes bya ba ni dma' bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Weight is that by which things are heavy, that is, by which they are made to go down.

original: 'di yod na dma' bar 'gyur bas na lci ba ste nongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yod na dma' bar 'gyur bas na lci ba ste nongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it exists, they go down, so it is weight, that is, it is a fault.

original: lci ba kho na lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: lci ba kho na lci ba nyid do //
translated: Weight itself is heaviness.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni gang las srang mtha' mtho bar 'gyur pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni gang las srang mtha' mtho bar 'gyur pa'o zhes so //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is that by which the end of a scale rises.üîΩThe opposite of that is light.

original: bzlog pa ni yang ba'o zhes bya ba la gang gis dngos po rnams 'jal bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni yang ba'o zhes bya ba la gang gis dngos po rnams 'jal bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: That by which things are not weighed is light.

original: 'di yod na dma' bar mi 'gyur bas yang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na dma' bar mi 'gyur bas yang ba'o //
translated: If it exists, they do not go down, so it is light.

original: dbyibs rgya che ba nyid la yang yaddh'a b'at su kha m'a hri yante bh'a b'a: 'jal ban srang mtha' dmar po'i rgyu mtshan las zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams zer ro //
analyzed: dbyibs rgya che ba nyid la yang yaddh'a b'at su kha m'a hri yante bh'a b'a: 'jal ban srang mtha' dmar po'i rgyu mtshan las zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that heaviness is the quality of an object that causes it to fall when moved by the mind.

original: yang ba kho na yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang ba kho na yang ba nyid do //
translated: Lightness is the opposite of that.

original: grang ba na dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis nyam thag pas dro bar 'dod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: grang ba na dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis nyam thag pas dro bar 'dod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Cold is that which, when touched, causes a desire for warmth.

original: de ni bgrang bas na grang ba ste phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir myur du bgrod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni bgrang bas na grang ba ste phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir myur du bgrod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called cold because it quickly moves through the body, since it benefits or harms quickly.

original: gal te yang sos ka dang ston ka'i dus ba zhin grang ba ni dro bar 'dod par byed par mi 'gyur ba ma min nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang sos ka dang ston ka'i dus ba zhin grang ba ni dro bar 'dod par byed par mi 'gyur ba ma min nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt cold not desired in the spring and autumn?
